loans.name: Kursih

texts.en: Kursih, 43, married to O. and has 3 children. They both own a small grocery store at their house, earning $10 a day. She joined MBK so she could expand her business and increase their income. Now she is asking for a loan of $75 and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Francisco Fernando

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco lives with his wife and three children in the Memorial Sandino projects. For the past eight years he has been driving a taxi that he bought with the severance pay he received after working many years as a salesman at the Oriental market. With the daily income generated by the taxi he covers the household expenses and helps with the purchases his wife makes at the market in order to supply the grocery store they own and run. Both incomes have allowed them to cover all the needs of the family. They presently want to finish the walls and be able to lock the house to make it safer. His plans are to continue improving their house, buy a new taxi and hire a driver as, due to his age, it is difficult for him to drive eight hours nonstop daily.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco habita con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en el asentamiento Memorial Sandino. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a conducir un taxi que compró con su liquidación después de trabajar muchos años como vendedor en el mercado oriental. Con los ingresos que genera diariamente el taxi aporta en los gastos de la casa, además de apoyar con los mandados y compras que realiza su esposa en el mercado, con el objetivo de abastecer la pulpería con la que cuenta esta familia. Ambos ingresos les han permitido cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. En estos momentos, la necesidad es terminar de construir el muro de su vivienda, el cual pueda cerrar y así su vivienda esté segura. Los planes del señor es la de ir mejorando su vivienda, comprar un nuevo carro y contratar a un chofer que lo maneje, ya que debido a su edad, le cuesta mucho manejar 8 horas sin parar.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, iron, sand and stone.

loans.name: Tania Liseth

texts.es:
Ms. Tania lives in the Hialeah neighborhood. She is 42 years old and has two children -10 and 14 years old. She sells curd, cheese, cream, fried pork and ‘chicharrón’ (toasted pork skin). These typical products are highly consumed by Nicaraguans, and they also serve as complements of dialy meals. She sells these products in high demand at home, mostly by order. The income from this activity is low, but her husband works as a warehouse manager at a company, and in this way they manage to meet the basic needs of the family.

The wish of these parents is to improve the conditions of their house, so that their children have a proper home, which provides conditions that allow for development, and a nice living environment. She presently wants to start putting up the front wall of a concrete house, as well as put bars on the door to increase security, as her neighborhood is inhabited by youngsters dedicated to break into houses to steal.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tania habita en el barrio Hialeah, tiene 42 años y dos hijos de 10 y 14 años. Se dedica a vender cuajada, queso, crema, quesillos, frito (carne frita de cerdo) y chicharrón (piel del cerdo tostada), los cuales son muy consumidos por los nicaragüenses por ser productos típicos, además de que sirven como complemento en las comidas que se consumen diariamente. Ella comercializa estos productos de alta demanda en su vivienda, y vende mayormente por encargo. Los ingresos de esta actividad son bajos, pero su esposo trabaja como responsable de bodega en una empresa, lo cual le permite a esta familia satisfacer sus necesidades básicas.

El deseo de estos padres es el de ir mejorando la condición habitacional de su vivienda, con el objetivo de que sus hijos cuenten con una vivienda digna, con condiciones en la cual le permitan desarrollarse y vivir en un ambiente agradable. En estos momentos, la señora desea empezar a levantar la pared del frente de la vivienda de concreto además de poner verjas a las puertas, la cual le brinde mayor seguridad, ya que en su barrio existe muchos jóvenes en riesgo que se dedican a robar pertenencias ajenas de las viviendas.

loans.use: Purchase of curd, cheese, cream, pork and ‘chicharrón’.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio is 35 years old and is from the community of Ríos-Ticuantepe. He works growing pineapples, and has 15 years of vast knowledge in the management and sale of pineapples. His work in this field has enabled him to support his wife and son, who is currently in his last year of high school. The greatest desire of these parents is to be able to give their son all the things he needs in order to develop in a healthy family environment, as well as prepare him for university studies.

Mr. P. S. spends as much time as possible taking care of and maintaining his plantations, which require organic supplies that are very expensive. In order to support his family while the pineapples are growing, Remigio makes trips in his truck transporting vendors from Ticantepe to the oriental market in Managua. In this way, he makes extra income and is able to make up for his expenses, while he is also able to count on the support of his wife, who sells fruits and vegetables in the markets of Managua. This is how these parents have gotten ahead for their son. Remigio is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and chemical fertilizers that are required in order to grow good quality pineapples.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Don Remigio tiene 35 años, es originario de la comunidad de los Ríos - Ticuantepe, se dedica a producir piña, posee 15 años de vasta experiencia en el manejo y comercialización del mismo, el dedicarse a esta actividad le ha permitido mantener a su esposa y su hijo quien se encuentra estudiando en último año de la secundaria, el mayor deseo de estos padres es el de brindarles a su hijo todas las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle en un ambiente familiar agradable además de prepararlo para que estudie una carrera universitaria.

El señor le dedica el mayor tiempo posible al cuido y mantenimiento de sus plantaciones, las cuales requieren de muchos insumos orgánicos los cuales tienen un alto costo. Para poder mantener a su familia mientras la cosecha sale, el señor realiza viajes en su camioneta en donde traslada a comerciantes de Ticuantepe al mercado oriental (Managua), de esta forma adquiere ingresos extras que le permite subsanar todos los gastos además de contar con el apoyo de su esposa quien vende frutas y verduras en los mercados de Managua. Es así como estos padres han sacado adelante a su hijo. En estos momentos el señor solicita un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas y abonos químicos que requiere para poder sacar piña de buena calidad.

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Evense Francisco

texts.es:
Evenses is 29 years old and lives with his wife and small child in the community of San Ignacio, a municipality of Ticuantepe. He is employed as a manager of a warehouse for an agricultural company, where he already has various years work experience. As a result of his work, he was able to save and purchase two plots of land, where he grows pineapple and “pitahaya” (dragon fruit), since in the community in which he lives, these are the products that are most produced due to the climate. For five years, he has been taking his products to Managua to sell, where they have been well received. Besides, he has a good number of regular customers who always buy from him. With all of this work, this father is in charge of all of the family expenses and his greatest wish is to provide his wife and child with a better quality of life, as well as a home which provides adequate conditions. It is this way that Evenses wishes to continue to produce his products which obtain good profits. Right now, Evenses is requesting a loan to purchase organic inputs which are needed for pineapple cultivation since this fruit has the most demand in the markets of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Evenses tiene 29 años de edad, habita con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en la comunidad de San Ignacio, municipio de Ticuantepe. El señor se desempeña de responsable de bodega de una empresa agrícola, en la cual ya lleva varios años de estar trabajando, fruto de su trabajo es como el señor llegó a ahorrar y comprar 2 manzanas de tierra, en las cuales tiene sembrado piña y pitahaya, ya que en la comunidad donde habita son los productos que mas se produce debido al ambiente climático, lleva 5 años de estar sacando sus productos a comercializar a Managua, los cuales han tenido mucha aceptación, cuenta además con un buen numero de clientes fijos que siempre le compran. Con toda esta actividad, este padre de familia se hace cargo de todos los gastos de su familia, ya su mayor deseo es brindarle a su esposa e hijo mejores condiciones de vida así como una vivienda que preste todas las condiciones adecuadas. Es así que el señor desea seguir produciendo sus productos con los cuales obtiene buenas utilidades. En estos momentos, el señor solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos orgánicos que esta necesitando para el cultivo de piña, ya que es el que mayormente se cotiza en los mercados de Managua, debido a que tiene una gran demanda.

loans.use: Purchase urea and chemical fertilizers for the cultivation of pineapple.

loans.name: Sergio Rene

texts.es:
Mr. Sergio is 39 years of age and lives in Ticuantepe County. He works in the Territorial Studies Institute (INETER) as a hydromensor technician (measuring water levels). His family depends entirely on his only income to survive. Thanks to several microloans this family has been able to improve the poor conditions of their home. His wife takes care of their only child and Mr.Sergio wants to improve their living conditions so that they may lead a fuller life.

Through hard work and perseverance Mr.Sergio wants to improve the life of his family. He hopes to be able to give his son a proper education so he can have a career and to see him grow healthy and fulfilled.

To this end, Mr.Sergio is requesting a microloan which will improve his son´s bedroom and provide him with a tile floor in their living room as their current flooring is in a very poor state.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Eliseo has 25 years experience in the production of pineapple and “pitahaya” (dragon fruit), a skill which he developed with his family who live in Ticuantepe, an area that has a favorable climate. Eliseo works with the support of his four children in the maintenance and commercialization of the fruit. His wife is in charge of the housework and, on occasion, goes to markets to sell fruit. This family has been perfecting everything involved in the production process, as well as increasing their technical skills for the task of land maintenance. This is costly due to the items that are needed in each stage of the production process which are manual weeding or natural control of pests and the use of organic fertilizers, which provide them better yields, since they allow the soil not to deteriorate so much, providing better conditions for seed cultivation and a better quality harvest. With financing, this family will be able to maintain their crops, pay for the harvest, and, in this way, subsist since they offer their products during different seasons during the year which generates enough earnings for them. Eliseo is requesting a loan so he may purchase organic inputs, since the next harvest is in May and requires proper maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Don Eliseo tiene 25 años de experiencia en producir piña y pitahaya, actividad que la desarrolla con su familia, habita en Ticuantepe, zona que presenta un clima favorable. El señor trabaja con el apoyo de sus 4 hijos en el mantenimiento y comercialización de los frutos, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y en ocasiones sale a los mercados a vender frutas. Esta familia se han perfeccionado en todo el proceso productivo así como también se han ido tecnificando en la actividad del mantenimiento de las tierras el cual tiene un alto costo, debidos a los productos que necesitan en cada etapa del proceso productivo como son: el deshierbe manual o control natural de plagas y el uso de abonos orgánicos, el cual les brinda mejores rendimientos en su cultivo, ya que contribuye a que el suelo no se deteriore tanto, brindando mejores condiciones al cultivo en siembra y una cosecha de mayor calidad. Es con financiamiento como esta familia logra mantener sus cultivos, los cuales la cosecha misma le permite pagar y de esta manera es como subsisten. A parte que ofrecen sus productos en diferentes épocas del año, lo cual les genera suficientes ganancias con las que logran mantenerse. El señor solicita un préstamo para la compra de los insumos orgánicos, ya que la cosecha próxima esta por salir en mayo y por lo tanto requiere el debido mantenimiento.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
Mrs. Mireya is a 50 year old single mom living in Hialeah. Her son works as a welder and lives with his mother helping to contribute economically towards the expenses of the household.

She began her business 8 years ago selling poultry from her home. Later she expanded her business and set up a small general store offering vegetables, grains and sweets. The income generated from her store was insufficient so she decided to refurnish one of her rooms to rent it out.

Mrs. Mireya wants to offer a greater range of goods in her general store to include staple products such as chicken and cheese. She is unable to purchase these goods as her income is used up to make improvements in her humble home. The loan she is requesting will be used to rebuild the room she is renting. The person renting her room has complained that the walls are made of wood and zinc and has asked her to make the walls of concrete. She can´t afford to lose the income from the room, so she wants to make the improvements with the loan she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Thecho Village. She opened her shop four years ago to improve the living standards of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, paddy (uncut rice), snacks and noodles. In that area, the demand for groceries is constantly increasing. So, to meet the demand, she is asking for her fifth loan of Rs30000.00 to buy groceries for her shop.

Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband and daughter. Her husband, Mr. Krishna M., works in a college and her daughter is studying in grade 1.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her shop

loans.name: La Xmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi K. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. She lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Gopal K., and her children. Her husband is a teacher. Her daughter is studying in grade 10 and her son is in grade 8.

Mrs. Karmarcharya opened a grocery store three years ago to improve the living standards of her family. Due to lack of funds, she can’t buy goods for her shop. So, she is asking for her fourth loan of Rs 25000.00 to buy goods like rice, dhal (lentils), noodles, etc.

She needs the additional income to provide education for her son and wishes to help her husband to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her shop

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Jayanti K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, which is located in Lalitpur district of Nepal. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. K. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband, and her sons. Her sons are studying in grade 7 and 3, respectively.

Mrs. K. and her husband, Mr. Bishnu K., started their poultry farm five years ago. Her father-in-law and mother-in-law also help them in their work. They used to sell their chickens in the local market. Now Mrs. K. is requesting her second loan of Rs15000.00 to buy small chickens.

loans.use: To buy small chickens for her farm

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Mrs. Sushila B. is a farmer in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, her husband, and two daughters. Her husband, Mr. Saroj B., is a teacher. Both of her daughters are studying in primary school.

Mrs. Bashet grows different types of vegetables in her own land. Mostly, she prefers to grow seasonal vegetables. She grows different vegetables like cauliflower and green vegetables. She sells the vegetables in a local market in the morning and in the evening every day. Now she is requesting for her first loan of Rs 5000.00 to buy fertilizers and seeds for her work.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Mrs. Shova K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur, Nepal. She lives with her mother-in-law and with her husband. Her husband, Mr. Dinesh K., is in Saudi-Arabia. He went there to work.

Mrs. K. is a farmer. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables in her land. Farming is their traditional work, so she doesn’t want to leave farming. She sells her vegetables in local market in the morning and in the evening.

Now Mrs. K. seeks Rs10000.00 loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her work. She wants to spend her income to improve the livings standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita A. lives in a single family with her husband and children in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur, Nepal. Her husband, Mr. Bashanta A., is in the Nepalese army. Her daughter is studying in grade 7 and her son is in grade 6.

Mrs. A. started her poultry farm three years ago to improve their standard of living. She sells her chickens in the local market. People also come to her home and buys chickens from her. Due to the lack of money, she can’t buy small chickens for her farm, so she is requesting for her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy small chickens.

loans.use: To buy small chickens

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Mrs. Subdra K., a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishapati, is a shopkeeper. Sainu-Bhaishapati is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur districts of Nepal. Most of the people in this village are engaged in farming. Mrs. K. lives in a single family with her husband and children. Her husband, Ram Kumar K., works in a government office.

Mrs. K. opened her grocery shop four years ago. Her children also help her in her shop. Mrs. K. sells different types of grocery items in her shop. She opened the grocery shop to help her husband meet the needs of their family and also to improve their standard of living.

Now Mrs. K. is requesting for her third loan of Rs20000.00 to buy groceries for her shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala M., a 64-year-old woman lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and daughter, and with her granddaughter. Her son works in a department store. Her daughter-in-law and daughter work in a noodle factory. Her granddaughter is in primary school.

Mrs. M. is a farmer in Sainbu-Bhaishapati village. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her land. She sells her vegetables in local market in the morning and in the evening.

Now she is requesting for her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a single mother of a six-year-old girl, and she lives in the café community of Santo Domingo where she carries on a small business.  She has been selling sweets and candies for eight months.  Margarita in general runs her business in a primary school, but every so often she also visits friends and neighbors to sell her goods.  She explains that she needs a local space for the business, so that she won’t have to leave her house every day and walk long distances to take her sweets to students and the neighbors.  With her loan, Margarita will buy many goods to keep preparing her delicious sweets and candies, and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to prepare sweets and candies for a small business.

loans.name: Maira Milady

texts.en:
Maira Milady is a teacher in a primary school located in the café community of Santo Domingo where she lives. Maira has three children, two boys and one girl. The girl attends a university and the boys go to secondary school.

Maira Milady has been producing an assortment of homemade sweets called sweet beans, for two years. She sells her goods in the school where she teaches. She explains that she continually has to buy goods such as milk, coco, sugar, sweet potato and so forth to prepare her sweets. With her loan, she plans on purchasing a large amount of raw materials so that she can produce more goods and increase her income.

Maira Milady wants to keep providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to produce sweet beans and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Altagracia's Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is in her late thirties and has four children, three of them girls, all of whom attend school. Altagracia initiated her relationship with us a couple of months ago, when she took from our organization a loan which she invested in clothing to resell in her community. The entrepreneur used her loan wisely, and managed to make her business successful. Altagracia is still running the business from her home, but she plans on renting a small local space before long so customers can make their purchases easier. The entrepreneur wants to increase her sales volume and her income.

Together with four other women, Altagracia is requesting a loan to buy a high volume of clothing in bulk to sell in the Café Community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneurs will receive the loan funds together, but each will carry on her business from her own local space. They will use the loan to buy clothing in bulk.

NOTE: The members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one of the women fails in repaying the loan, the other members have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: All the entrepreneurs will invest their loans in the purchase of clothing in bulk for their businesses.

loans.name: María Cristina's Group

texts.en:
María Cristina is the coordinator of a group of five businesswomen who live in the Carretón community of Baní, San Cristobal. María is 35 years old, and has three school-going children, two boys and a girl. She sells men’s and women’s clothing. María explains that she started her business last year when she realized that her husband’s salary could not bear all the family’s expenses.

Currently, she has a lot of customers that regularly visit her house to buy her goods. Bi-weekly, María Cristina has to go outside her community to Santo Domingo, the capital, to get garments at very good price. With her loan, María Cristina will buy clothing in bulk in order to restock her business and satisfy her customers’ needs.

The other members of the group are: Fiordaliza C., a 26-year-old mother of three children. She’ll invest her loan to buy pants, tennis gear, and perfumes for her business. Aracelis M. P. is the owner and operator of a beauty parlor. She’ll buy an assortment of beauty products for her store. Julia M. will buy some fashionable pants, skirts, and shirts for her business. Argentina S. will buy clothing in bulk to replenish her small store.

loans.use: Purchase of a collection of pants, beauty products, perfumes, and other goods for various businesses.

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en: Ulker A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city of Azerbaijan. She has been settled with her family in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan, since 1993. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She is engaged in clothing sales in Beylagan city bazaar. She has ten years of experience at this business. Ulker applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $200 to purchase socks, underwear, etc. and increase the variety of her goods.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods in her store.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer A. is a 30-year-old man who is married and has one son. He got married one year ago. Azer lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He sells building materials. He has rented a small shop and has been developing his business more than three years. He does not have many products in his shop, so he applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $600 to purchase more different kinds of goods and to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael A. is a 26-year-old man who has just married. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He owns and operates a small auto-repair store in his yard. He established his business five years ago. He needs a loan in amount of $600 to purchase a new materials for his auto-repair store.

loans.use: To expand auto repair business

loans.name: Aas

texts.en: Aas, 31, is married to A. and has 2 children. They have a pretty large farm with spinach and other vegetables. Every week they sell their vegetables and earn about $15 a week. Aas is a member of MBK and is now asking for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She agree to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani, 26, is married to E. and has 3 children. Her husband sells vegetables at the market and earns $10 a day. To add to her family income, she sells clothes on credit door-to-door. She collects the payment weekly and earns $8 a week. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Titin Suharni

texts.en: Titin, 33, is a mother of 2 children, ages 11 and 2. Every day she sells clothing at the market, such as children's clothes and underwear, earning $20 a day. Her husband, K., also sells clothing door to door and earns $10 a day. To expand her business and earn more income, Titin is requesting a loan of $75, and as a member of MBK, she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Totoh Isah

texts.en: Totoh, 36, is married to H., and they have 3 children. Her husband cannot provide regular income for the family, and Totoh earns the family income by selling kitchen wears such as pans, frying pans, iron cases, etc., door-to-door around villages, earning $15 a day. She is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business so she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra, a thirty-seven year old mother of two boys and two girls, lives in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal, where she operates a small business. Sandra sells a collection of sneakers and shoes to friends and neighbors. She has been running this activity for more than one year, and now she wants to boost her business and add new styles of shoes in order to attract more people and increase her sales volume.

Sandra hopes she’ll get this loan before long so that she can achieve these goals and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of shoes and sneakers in order to restock her small store.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María sells fried vegetables and ripe fruits in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. She has a lot of experience, since she has been carrying on different kinds of businesses for a long time. María is thirty-six years old, and she has three children, two girls and a boy. They all attend school.

The entrepreneur explains that she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to increase her sales volume and her income. María’s business supports her children’s educations. The entrepreneur says she’ll keep working hard to provide a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits in order to expand a small business.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.es:
Adelita M. is a single mother of 2 children, to whom she wishes to always give the best, which is why she started making and selling paintings to her friends and family. She started with one painting, then two, and so on. Little by little and with a lot of effort, Adelita was able to support her two children through this business.

Nevertheless, it is time for her to get more capital so that she can offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $650.00 USD, which she is willing to repay in 6 monthly installments, so that she can buy a painting simulator and make frames for her art. With your help, Adelita will be able to move her family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelita M., es madre soltera de 2 pequeños. A quienes desea brindarles siempre lo mejor. Es por eso que comenzó a elaborar y a vender cuadros entre sus familiares y amigos. Primero con un cuadro y después con dos y así consecutivamente. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo Adelita a podido mantener a sus dos hijos con este negocio.

Sin embargo es momento para que el negocio se inyecte de más capital para poder tener más mercancía y así ofrecerles variedad a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Adelita podrá comprar un simulador de pinturas y formar un marco para sus diseños. Con tu ayuda Adelita podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of painting simulator

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli is a hardworking woman who likes to fight for her family. A year ago she started selling cosmetics by catalog, in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Little by little her clientele has grown as have her sales, which has allowed her to help support the family. Her husband is a construction worker and his income is not sufficient to cover the needs of their child.

Presently Araceli has several pending orders. As she doesn’t have the money to buy the products to meet those orders, she is requesting a loan of $375, which she will repay in six months. With your help, Araceli will be able to help her family advance.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Araceli es una mujer a quien le gusta luchar por su familia. Hace 1 año comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Poco a poco ha ido haciéndose de clientes y eso ha logrado que ella venda más y ayude con los gastos, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero y lo que gana no es suficiente para pagar todo lo que necesita su hijo.

Actualmente Araceli tiene varios pedidos pendientes. Puesto que no cuenta con recursos suficientes para poder surtirlos, está solicitando un crédito de US $375, que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Araceli podrá ayudar a que su familia salga adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov S. is a widow with five children who works as a rice seller in front of Bontey Srey temple and makes on average about $2 of profit a day. Three of her children are married and live away from home while the other two work in a restaurant as a waiter and as a motor-taxi driver. To produce more revenue, she needs a loan from Kiva in the amount of $700  to create another business, like purchasing pigs to breed.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Carmita

texts.es:
Carmita S. is a single mother who has supported her daughter selling clothes, for the past six years, initially in the area where she lives and later in nearby towns. She also works as domestic help three days a week, which allows her to meet new clients. Her 17 years old daughter has married and lives with her husband, but Carmita continues to sell clothes, as this is her main income. In the future she wishes to have her own store.

At present Carmita doesn’t have a lot of merchadise in stock. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $300, which she will repay in five months. With the money she will be able to buy more season clothes and increase the variety she offers. With your help, Carmita will be able to establish her business and save for expenses that might arise.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmita S. es madre soltera y durante 6 años ha mantenido a su hija vendiendo ropa, inicialmente en la comisaría donde vive y después en poblaciones cercanas. También es empleada doméstica 3 días a la semana, lo que la ayuda a conocer más clientes. Su hija, quien tiene 17 años, ya se casó y vive con su esposo, pero ella continua vendiendo por que es su único ingreso. En un futuro ella desea tener su propio local.

Sin embargo Carmita no cuenta actualmente con mucha mercancía. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 5 meses. Con este dinero Carmita podrá comprar más ropa de temporada para poder tener variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Carmita podrá establecer su negocio y ahorrar para los gastos que se le presenten.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
As a kid, Maricela S. observed that her parents used to raise pigs, in order to obtain an extra income to help with the household expenses. When she got married, she gave this activity a try as well, with good results. It has helped build her house. She presently wants to set up more pigsties, in order to increase the number of pigs she raises. For this reason, she is requesting a $300 loan, to be repaid in five months. With the money, Maricela will be able to buy more pigs to be fatten and sold. With your help, Maricela will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde niña, Maricela S. observó que sus papás criaban cerdos y de ahí obtenían ingresos extras que contribuían al gasto familiar; por ello, cuando se casó, quiso también probar teniendo buen resultado; esta actividad le ha ayudado a construir su casa, y ahora desea construir más chiqueros para aumentar el número de cerdos de engorda. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300, que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 5 meses. Con este dinero Maricela podrá comprar más lechones (puercos), para poder engordarlos y venderlos. Con tu ayuda Maricela podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs to raise.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
Upon seeing the expenses in her home, Celsa decided to take advantage of her experience in the creation and sale of fried food and started selling salbutes, panuchos and empanadas on weekends. Little by little her business has been growing.

However, she does not have a place where her customers can sit to eat the delicious food she prepares, and this is why she is requesting a loan for 3000 Mexican Pesos, which she is willing to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money Celsa will be able to buy merchandise such as chairs, tables, and other things so that her customers may stay and enjoy the food. With your help, Celsa will be able to get ahead with her business and establish it as a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Celsa, al ver los gastos que habían en su hogar, decidió aprovechar su experiencia en la elaboración y venta de fritangas e inicio la venta en fines de semana de salbutes, panuchos y empanadas, poco a poco está creciendo su negocio.

Sin embargo, no cuenta con un área para que sus clientes se puedan sentar a comer la rica comida que prepara, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de 3000 pesos mexicanos, que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Celsa podrá comprar mercancía como sillas, mesas y otras cosas para que sus clientes se queden a disfrutar la comida. Con tu ayuda Celsa podrá salir adelante con su negocio y establecerlo como un restaurant.

loans.use: Buying chairs and tables (Comprar sillas y mesas)

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria has always liked having her own income and helping her husband with expenses. This is why she started a business selling sodas and antojitos (literally, "little cravings", traditional appetizers/snacks). She started this business 3 years ago and it has turned out very well because she can count on a large high school among her customers. Thanks to this, and to Candelaria's enthusiasm, she has managed to establish herself in her community.

However, Candelaria does not have enough merchandise to offer more variety in her business. This is why she is requesting a loan for U. $250, which she is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money Candelaria will be able to buy more merchandise to prepare different Mexican antojitos. With your help Maria Ofelia will be able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Candelaria siempre le ha gustado tener sU. ingresos y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos, es por eso que comenzó con el negocio de venta de refrescos y antojitos, lo inicio hace 3 años, y le ha resultado bueno ya que tiene una escuela de nivel medio superior que cuenta con un numeroso alumnado. Gracias a esto y a que Candelaria tiene mucho entusiasmo es que se a logrado posicionar en su localidad.

Sin embargo Candelaria actualmente no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecer más variedad en su negocio. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de U. $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Candelaria podrá comprar mercancía nueva para elaborar otros antojitos mexicanos. Con tu ayuda Canelaria podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buying new merchandise (Comprar mercancía nueva)

loans.name: Te

texts.en: Mrs. Te L. (pictured in the red shirt) is a 48-year-old widow with one daughter. She stays at home to look after the house and to cook food. In addition, she works as a farmer and as a clothes vendor in the market. Because her business is growing, she needs additional funds to purchase more clothes that she can then sell at the market. Therefore, she is seeking a $700 loan from Kiva to allow her to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to be sold at the market

loans.name: Flor Guadalupe

texts.es:
Flor N. likes sales and started selling food, increasing her clientele little by little, first among neighbors and later among employees of nearby companies. Flor started her business to be able to pay for the expenses of her two children, a 13-year-old girl and a 14-year-old boy. Thanks to this business she has been able to help her husband with the expenses of their schooling.

However, right now she needs to buy more merchandise to be able to make more products to offer to her customers. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $250, which she is willing to pay in a period of 3 months. With this money Flor will be able to buy raw materials to produce her merchandise. With your help Flor will be able to see her family succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Flor N. le gusta las ventas e inicio la venta de comida teniendo poco a poco clientela primero entre vecinos y posteriormente a los empleados de las empresas cercanas. Flor empezó su negocio para poder pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos una niña de 13 años y un niño de 14. Gracias a este negocio a podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la escuela de ellos.

Sin embargo actualmente necesita comprar más mercancía para poder elaborar más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses. Con este dinero Flor podrá comprar insumos para elaborar su mercancía. Con tu ayuda Flor podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sari

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sari is a grandmother with ten grandchildren. Her four children all are married and live separately. Ni Ketut Sari and her husband is getting older, but they have such a high spirit. To be more productive, Ni Ketut Sari opens a food mart in her house. Ni Ketut Sari sells daily goods such as vegetable, traditional cookies from her neighbor, and a wide assortment of snacks and beverages. Everyday, escorted by her husband, Ni Ketut Sari shops at a pre dawn market in the nearby city. She is home by 5 AM and opens her store. She spends almost IDR 300,000 everyday. (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between IDR 9,000-9,500.00). Her daily revenue could reach IDR 150,000-200,000. Her average profit is IDR 20,000 per day. Since her store is always crowded, Ni Ketut Sari is very excited to work to keep her customers happy.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sari seorang nenek dengan 10 cucu karena 4 anaknya semuanya sudah berkeluarga dan tidak tinggal bersamanya. Ni Ketut Sari dan suaminya sudah lanjut usia. Tetapi semangat hidupnya sangat tinggi. Supaya tidak kesepian Ni Ketut Sari membuka usaha dagang dirumahnya. Ni Ketut Sari menjual kebutuhan sehari – hari, seperti sayur - sayuran, kue-kue tradisional yang dititip tetangganya dan berbagai macam makanan dan minuman ringan. Setiap hari, dengan diantar suaminya, Ni Ketut Sari berbelanja di pasar pagi di kotanya. Jam 5 pagi, Ni Ketut Sari sudah sampai dirumah dan mulai membuka warungnya. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Sari mengeluarkan modal hampir Rp. 300.000.- Dan pendapatan perhari bisa mencapai Rp. 150.000.- sd Rp. 200.000.-. Dengan rata-rata keuntungan perhari yang diperolehnya Rp. 20.000,-. Karena ramainya orang yang berbelanja kewarungnya, Ni ketut Sari menjadi semangat untuk bekerja supaya pelanggannya tidak hilang.

loans.use: To add more working capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: María Dorotea

texts.es:
Maria Dorotea worked at a maquiladora factory, and she noticed that in her town there are many factories whose employees required meals. This is why she took advantage of this opportunity and started selling food out of her home, taking it to factories, and offering it at low prices. Maria Dorotea is a widow and is the sole support of her children of 19, 11, and 9 years of age.

Currently, Maria Dorotea would like to expand her sales to be able to pay for her children's studies. This is why she is requesting a loan for U. $250 which she is willing to pay in a period of 3 months. With this money Maria will be able to buy merchandise to make more food. With your help Maria will be able to move her business forward and help her children so they can go to college.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Dorotea, trabajaba en una maquiladora y observó que en el pueblo hay muchas empresas maquiladoras y sU. empleados demandaban comida corrida, por lo que aprovechó la oportunidad e inicio la venta de comida en su casa llevando a las empresas a precios módicos, María Dorotea es viuda y es la que sostiene a sU. dos hijos de 19, 11 y 9 años.

Actualmente María Dorotea, desea crecer sU. ventas para poder pagar los estudios de sU. hijos. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de U. $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía para elaborar más comidas. Con tu ayuda María logrará impulsar su negocio y ayudar a sU. hijos a que estudien una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Buying material to prepare meals (Comprar material)

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
For four years María del Carmen has sold shoes by catalog. This past year she had health problems and spent her capital, and now that she is picking herself up again she requires capital to buy more products.

For this reason she is requesting a loan of US $250 which she will repay over three months. With this money María del Carmen will be able to increase her inventory in order to be able to provide her clients with more variety. With your help María del Carmen will be able to move beyond this problem and establish her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 4 años que María del Carmen se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo, el año pasado tuvo problemas de salud y mermo su capital, ahora nuevamente esta levantándose y requiere de capital para compras mas productos.

Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero María del Carmen logrará incrementar su inventario para poder tener más variedad para sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María del Carmen logrará salir delante de este problema y establecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em O. is 49 years old and works as a housewife during the day. As such, she stays at home, looks after the children, and cooks food for her entire family. To support the family, her husband works as a boat laborer and makes, on average, $2.60 of profit per day. They have four children, two of whom are students and two of whom are goldsmiths (a goldsmith typically earns $5 per day). This couple is seeking a loan from Kiva so that they can purchase a motor-bike and some goldsmith tools.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike and goldsmith tools.

loans.name: Genny Guadalupe

texts.es:
Genny used to work selling cosmetics, but because of economic problems she separated from her partner and found it necessary to work in domestic labor. Now she wishes to once again dedicate herself to the sale of beauty products, as she knows many neighbors and in this way will be able to have another income, which would help her improve her quality of life. She supports her three children of 6, 5 and 2 years of age.

Nonetheless, currently she does not have enough merchandise to offer to her clients. For this reason she is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay over three months. With this money Genny will be able to buy merchandise and help her children get ahead. With your help Genny will be able to overcome this problem.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Genny se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, por problemas económicos se separó de su pareja y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar en labores domésticas, ahora desea dedicarse nuevamente a la venta de productos de belleza ya que conoce a muchas vecinas y así poder tener otro ingreso, que la ayude a mejorar su calidad de vida. Puesto que tiene que mantener a sus tres hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Genny podrá comprar mercancía y así sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con tu ayuda Genny logrará superar este problema.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim M. is 26 years old and her husband is Mr. Ly Treiya. They have two school-age children. Mrs. Sim M. practices Khmer traditional medicine at her house and, on average, she earns $5 per day. Her husband was working for a company as a taxi-driver in the Kampong Cham province and typically earned approximately $2.50 per day, but he recently stopped working as a driver for that company. Now, he wants to purchase a second-hand car in order to transport people from Kampong Cham province to Phnom Penh, so they are requesting a $700 loan from Kiva to purchase a used car.

loans.use: To purchase a used card to be utilized as a taxi.

loans.name: Gilda Isabel

texts.es:
Gilda is the type of woman who likes to help her husband with the household expenses. In addition, her husband’s income is not enough to cover these expenses. It was for this reason that three years ago she began to sell lingerie by catalog to her neighbors. Little by little she has been increasing her sales and is making herself known in her area.

Nevertheless the household expenses are increasing due to the fact that they have a son in school. Because of this she does not have enough capital to be able to buy merchandise. She is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay over 3 months, and with this money Gilda will be able to purchase merchandise and her clients will have something to choose from. With your help Gilda will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Gilda es una mujer a la que le gusta ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de la casa. Fue por eso que comenzó hace 3 años a vender artículos de lencería por catálogo entre sus vecinas. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas. Puesto que se está haciendo conocida en su localidad.

Sin embargo los gastos de su casa van incrementando, puesto que tiene a su hijo estudiando. Es por eso que no cuenta con capital suficiente para poder comprar mercancía. Por eso está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Gilda podrá comprar mercancía para que sus clientas tengan de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda Gilda logrará sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
Maria Ofelia always liked sales and interacting with people, so she took advantage of her popularity in the neighborhood and opened a small general store in her home. The store is now recognized by many people in the neighborhood, and because of this, she would like to keep growing, and with the increase in profits, improve her and her family's quality of life.

However, currently Maria Ofelia does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $250, which she is willing to pay in a period of 3 months. With this money Maria Ofelia will be able to buy more merchandise so that her customers can always find what they are looking for. With your help Maria Ofelia will be able to establish her business more solidly, and in this way help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Ofelia, siempre le gustaron las ventas y el trato con L. gente y aprovechó que era conocida en L. colonia, y con un ahorro abrió una tiendita D. abarrotes en su casa, que hoy ya esta reconocida por mucha gente D. L. colonia, por ello quiere seguir creciendo y con las ganancias mejorar su calidad D. vida y L. D. su familia.

Sin embargo actualmente María Ofelia no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito D. US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 3 meses y con este dinero María Ofelia podrá comprar más mercancía para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan. Con tu ayuda María Ofelia logrará establecer mejor su negocio para así apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Prek Svay I Group

texts.en:
This loan will be shared between 29 members of the Prek Svay I Village Bank in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Chantha N., age 46, is the Village Bank president. She and her husband are farM. and, between the two of them, make around $11 per day. She has five children. Her eldest child works in a factory from 1:00-5:00 p.m. every day, and is also a student. The other four children do not work, but attend school. She would like to request a loan in order to buy fertilizer, as well as food that she would then sell. She would also use the money to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food, fertilizer, and support their childrens' education

loans.name: Keth

texts.en: Mrs. Keth S. is 37 years old and has four children. She works with her husband and they make small mills (a mill weighs approximately 10 - 15 kilograms and is made from hard stone). On average, they earn approximately $6 of profit per day. They are requesting a $500 loan from Kiva to purchase a motor bike to easily transport their products so that they can sell such products at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to transport their products to the market for sale.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita Beat

texts.es:
Reina Margarita is married and has a young son who is 2 months old. To be able to pay for the household expenses, she rents taxi license plates and has a driver who reports on what he makes every day. She has been doing this for a few years, but recently she used some of her savings and was left without capital for unexpected expenses, such as the one she has now when that she wants to maintain the car.

This is why she is requesting a loan for US $250 which she is willing to pay in a period of 3 months. With this money Reina will be able to fix her car so that it keeps working. With your help Reina will be able to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Reina Margarita, está casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 meses, para poder pagar los gastos de su casa renta unas placas de taxi y tiene chofer que diario le entrega cuentas desde hace algunos años lo ha venido haciendo, a ultimas fechas dispuso de unos ahorros y se quedo sin capital para imprevistos, como es el caso de ahora que desea darle mantenimiento al carro.

Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Reina logrará arreglar su carro para que este siga funcionando. Con tu ayuda Reina podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Fix the taxi (Arreglar el taxi)

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Ediberta is a single mother, a situation that forced her to have an economic activity that would help her support her children. She also works as a cleaning lady in houses. In a government sponsored program, she learned how to make crafts and with that she worked creating decorations and noticed that in her town there is no notions store, so she combines the three activities.

Thanks to her enthusiasm, she has a great demand. On some occasions she does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers and this is why she is requesting a loan for US $300 which she is determined to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money Edilberta will be able to buy more merchandise to help her business and two children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Edilberta es Madre soltera, situación que la obligó a tener una actividad económica que le ayudase ha mantener a sus hijos, también realiza labores domesticas en casas, en un programa de gobierno logró aprender a realizar manualidades y con ello se dedicó a realizar adornos y observo que en su pueblo no había mercería por lo que combina las tres actividades.

Gracias a su entusiasmo, la demanda que tiene es grande. Y en ocasiones no tiene la mercancía suficiente para poder atender a sus clientes es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Edilberta podrá comprar más mercancía para sacar adelante su negocio y a sus dos hijos.

loans.use: buying merchandise (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Hout

texts.en: Mrs. Hout M. is 45 years old, is married with five children and works with her husband as a selling variety of vegetables. On average, she earns $8 per day of profit. To make the business more lucrative, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase vegetables in bulk (to reduce costs) and to re-sell such vegetables to generate greater profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
With the help of her husband who works as a laborer, Maria Eugenia decided to start their own business and so they set up a small general store two years ago. Through much effort they have managed to keep it stocked and increase their business.

However, they do not have the variety they need for their customers. This is why Maria Eugenia is requesting a loan for US $300, which she is determined to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money she will be able to buy more merchandise to carry a larger variety of products. With your help Maria Eugenia will be able to make progress together with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Eugenia, junto con la ayuda de su esposo que se desempeña como albañil decidieron abrir su propio negocio y así formaron una pequeña tienda de abarrotes hace 2 años ellos han logrado con mucho esfuerzo tener inventario y crecer su negocio.

Sin embargo no cuentan con la variedad que ella necesita para sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener variedad en sus productos. Con tu ayuda María Eugenia logrará salir adelante junto con su familia.

loans.use: buying more merchandise (comprar más mercancía)

loans.name: Chon

texts.en: Mr. Chon S. is 27 years old and works as a motor-taxi driver. On a typical day, he earns $2.50 of profit. His wife, who is also 27 years old, works as a farmer and earns, on average, $1 of profit per day. To allow the family to live a better life, this couple would like to start another business (such as raising pigs) to generate additional income, but they do not have enough money to do so. As a result, they are seeking a $600 loan from Kiva to start a pig-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and breed.

loans.name: María Del Carmen Gab

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is a single mom who found herself with the need to have a stable job to support her daughter, because her partner left to go to the USA and did not return. She started with the help of her mother, and little by little she began to stock her business until she established a small store, which she hopes to make grown and some day have a grand general store.

This is why she is requesting a loan for US$300, which she is willing to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money Maria del Carmen will be able to buy merchandise and in this way expand her business. With your help Maria will be able to support her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María del Carmen, es Madre soltera y se vio en la necesidad de tener un trabajo estable para mantener a su hija ya que su pareja se fue a los EEUU y no regreso, empezó con ayuda de su mama y poco a poco fue surtiendo su negocio hasta establecer un pequeño estanquillo que espera algún día hacer crecer y tener una gran tienda de abarrotes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María del Carmen podrá comprar abarrotes para así ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda María logrará sacar adelante a su hija.

loans.use: buying merchandise (comprar más mercancía)

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao H. is 56 years old, is a mother of ten children, and works as a farmer on her rice field. Each day she generates approximately $0.50 of profit. To supplement their household income, her husband also works as farmer and typically earns $0.50 per day as well. Five of their children work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh and earn a salary of $80 per month. The couple is seeking a $600 loan from Kiva to purchase sand, wood, and other raw materials to renovate their house because the house is old and needs improvements.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to renovate their house.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
When Maria del Carmen saw that what her husband made as a laborer was not enough to cover the household expenses, she started buying and selling bread among the neighbors of their community. This business has turned out well for them, although now she does not want to buy the bread to re-sell, but rather produce it on her own.

This is why she is requesting a loan for US $300, which she is determined to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money, Maria del Carmen will be able to buy material to make the bread and increase her profit margin. With your help, Maria del Carmen will help her family succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María del Carmen al ver que su marido no le alcanzaba con lo que ganaba como albañil para cubrir los gastos de la casa, ella inicio la compra y venta de pan entre los vecinos de la comunidad, negocio que le ha ido resultando, aunque ahora desea no comprarlos para revender sino elaborarlos por su cuenta.

Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María del Carmen podrá comprar material para elaborar los panes y así poder tener más margen de ganancias. Con tu ayuda María del Carme podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buying materials to make bread (Comprar material para elaborar los panes)

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: Mrs. Lois L. is 56 years old, is a widow with two children, and works as a farmer. On average, she earns $2 per day. Her children work in the factory to supplement their family's income. To generate additional revenue and income, Mrs. Lea L. is currently requesting a loan $300 from Kiva to purchase additional pigs to raise and breed.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs to raise and breed.

loans.name: Vart

texts.en: Mrs. Vart T., 43, is a widow with three children and works as a cow broker. Normally she earns on average around $4 a day of profit. Two of her children work in the garment factory typically earns $90 per month. And her son-in-law works works as a motor-taxi driver, earning $3 per day of profit. Mrs. Vart T. is requesting a loan $500 from Kiva to purchase more cows so that she can be resold for a profit. ( Mrs. Vart T. took picture with her granddaughter).

loans.use: To purchase additional cows to resell for profit

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van I. is 29 years old and is the mother of two children. She works as a construction laborer and earns approximately $2 of profit per day. Her husband, Mr. Sai Vuthy, also works as a construction laborer, and he typically earns $2 per day as well. The couple is requesting a $500 loan from Kiva so that they can purchase a motor bike for transportation purposes and to renovate their house. In the future, they would like to raise pigs to generate additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike for transportation purposes and to renovate their house.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Van Ith has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Mr. Prum P. owns a plot of farmland where he grows rice and typically earns approximately $1 per day. His wife works as a housewife and stays at home to look after their children and to cook food for the entire family. The couple has nine children, one of whom is married and lives away from their home. Two of their children collect recyclable materials by going door-to-door in the village and they re-sell the materials to the plant to earn approximately $100 each month. Moreover, another child works in the garment factory and has a salary of $40 per month, while another child is a blacksmith and earns approximately $20 per month. The couple hopes to receive a $300 loan from Kiva so that they can purchase a motor bike to transport the recyclable items to the plant.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to transport recyclable products to the plant for re-sale.

loans.name: Taing

texts.en: Mrs. Taing S. L. is 56 years old and she is a widow with five children. She raises pigs for a living and typically earns $2 per day. Three of her children are married and live away from her home. Her two other children, both of whom live with her at home, work to supplement the household income: one works as a hair dresser and has a salary of $80 per month, while the other child is employed by a garment factory and earns approximately $70 per month. To generate more revenue and income, Mrs. Taing S. L. wants to breed more pigs, so she is requesting a $300 loan from Kiva to do so.

loans.use: To breed additional pigs.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mrs. Pon S. Ol is 23 years old and is a mother of school-age children. She stays at home to look after the house and to cook food for her family. Meanwhile, her husband supports the family by collecting various items in his community that can be recycled and he re-sells these items to the plant to earn, on average, approximately $3.50 of profit per day. In order to more easily transport the recycled products to the plant, the couple is requesting a $300 loan from Kiva to purchase a motor bike.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to transfer recycled products to the plant for re-sale.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Pon Sam and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mr. Van V. is 45 years old and works as a horse cart driver in his village; on average, he earns $3 of profit per day. His wife, Mrs. Sam Lim Heang, is also 45 years old, and since 2005 she has been working as a tailor in Phnom Penh; on average, she earns $2 of profit per day. The couple has five children, one of whom is married and does not live with them at their home. They hope to receive a $500 loan from Kiva so that they can purchase a horse.

loans.use: To purchase a horse.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van N. is 25 years old and has two children. She and her husband work in the garment factory and earn, on average, $2 of profit per day. The couple hopes to receive a $200 loan from Kiva so that they can build a new stairway at their house because their current stairway is old and dangerous.

loans.use: To build a new staircase at their home

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S., 54, is a widow with five children who works braiding cotton scarves. She normally makes on average $1.50 a day. Two of her daughters work in Phnom Penh as garment workers, earning a salary of $60 each a month. To supplement the household income, she wants to breed pigs and resell them, and to run that business she is requesting a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To breed pigs.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
Bahodir A. is 25 years old. He is married with one child and lives together with his parents and younger brother.

Bahodir is a cattleman. He has been raising cattle for the last four years. Currently his household owns cattle to the value of 8000.00 Somoni which is about US$2,000. The business is the main source of income allowing Bahodir to support his large family.

Bahodir is planning to purchase more cattle and fodder. He requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of seven months. This is the first loan for Bahodir and he promises to pay the loan in a timely manner and thanks all for supporting him

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Ilyes

texts.en:
Ilyes A. is 35 years old. He is married with two children.

Ilyes is a cattleman. At the same time Ilyes sells dried fruit in the local market. Ilyes has been working as a market vendor for 17 years. Thanks to these two businesses, he is able to support his family and make savings for the future education of his kids.

Ilyes wants to increase the turnover capital for his business selling dried fruit. For this purpose he requests US$600.00 for the term of nine months. The loan shall be spent purchasing dried fruit.

This is the first loan of Ilyes, however, he is sure he shall be able to pay it on time and thanks everyone who trusts and decides to support him.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruit.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S., 28, works as a housewife looking after the children and cooking food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Mei Sophea, works as a construction laborer, earning on average $4.20 a day. They have three children, who are all students. To provide the family with better living conditions, they agreed to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase cashew nuts and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem S. Khem, 27, is a housewife looking after her children and cooking food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Thang Chea, 28, is a guard who looks after a banana farm, making on average $1.20 a day of profit. To provide more income for the family, Nhem is requesting a loan from Kiva to rent a plot of farmland to grow a variety of vegetables.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland and grow a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Sahoba

texts.en:
K. Sahoba is 32 years old. She is raising two children alone. 

Sahoba is a market vendor. She sells fruit in the local market. Sahoba has a rather wide range of goods. She always tries to buy fresh fruit of good quality. Five years ago when the poor economic situation of her family forced her to start her own business, Sahoba started by selling only two boxes of apples. Now the business has become successful and generates a stable income allowing Sahoba to support her family.

Sahoba requests US$800.00 for the term of nine months. She is planning to purchase fruit wholesale in order to sell it later on at attractive prices for her customers. This is the first loan for Sahoba and she would like to assure all she shall be able to pay it on time and to thank all supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase  fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Pem

texts.en: Mrs. Pem S., 47, is a mother of three children and works selling grocery products, making on average $5 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. Nhem Bunheng, 48, is a mechanic, earning $2.60 a day. Two of their children are students while one is married and lives separately. This couple expects to expand their business with the loan from Kiva, which they will use to purchase more grocery products to sell in large quantities.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Bekmurat

texts.en:
A. Bekmurat is 25 years old. Bekmurat is a farmer, growing various crops like wheat and onions. At the same time he runs his own watermill. The photo shows Bekmurat's wife milling wheat grains. Bekmurat is ready to help his neighbors when they need to mill grains.

Now Bekmurat requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of seven months. The loan shall be spent on input materials like fertilizer, fuel, seeds and cattle. Also, part of the loan shall be used for paying the salaries of hired seasonal workers.

This is the first loan of Bekmurat and he is sure he shall be able to pay on time, and thanks all for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of mineral fertilizer, fuel, seeds and cattle and paying the salaries for hired seasonal workers.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
K. Akbar is 39 years old. He is married with seven children.

Akbar is a farmer. He grows such crops as onions and watermelons. At sale time, he raises cattle. For this season Akbar has planted wheat and onions and is planning to have a bumper crop and generate good income.

Today Akbar requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of nine months. He is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer required for his business. Akbar is applying for a loan for the first time and he would like to thank all for supporting him and to promise to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lutfillo

texts.en:
M. Lutfillo is 35 years old. He is married with four children. Lutfillo is a farmer. He produces agricultural crops like tomatoes, watermelons, wheat and others. He has been working the land for five years. When there is a hot season, his wife and the children help him in the field as you can see in the picture.

Each year Lutfillo grows crops sufficient for family consumption and for selling. Generating a stable income, Lutfillo is able to support his large family.

Today he requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of nine months. The loan shall be used for purchasing seeds and fertilizer. Lutfillo thanks everyone supporting him and promises to be accurate in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tusitukirewamu Lending Group

texts.en:
Rehema N. is the leader of the Tusitukilewamu Lending Group. Rehema’s business is selling dry fish from her home in Kyampisi. She does not even have a stall outside her house, but customers come in well knowing she has what they want. She is 60 years old and not married, with eight grown children and two grandchildren.

Rehema has been our client for nine years and there are no regrets on either side. Now that her children are big, most of her profits help with home beautification as well as catering for her grandchildren.

She is also a member of the womens affairs committee and such leadership is what brings her on as the chairperson of Tusitukilewamu Lending Group, the members of which will share in this loan.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish to increase profitability.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
N. Mahmud is 40 years old. He is a cattleman and he has been in this business for seven years. Currently Mahmud has a turnover in cattle of 9000.00 Somoni (US$2500.00). The business is stable and generates the main income for his large family and allows him to make savings for the future of his three kids.

Now Mahmud requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of seven months. He is planning to purchase cattle and fodder. Mahmud has had loans from IMON several times and has proved himself a reliable client. So, he promises to pay the loan on time and thanks everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Happines's Malapa Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Happines E. is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 13 and 10. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 50 and 60. Happines owns a food store where she works everyday from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. and from which she can earn a monthly profit of about $60.

She now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who has a business selling cloth.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Kayunga Development Group

texts.en:
Moses, the chairperson of Kayunga Development Group, travels to various villages in search of chickens, both local and hybrid. He then sells the chickens to his customers in Kayunga, mostly to restaurants and hotels. Sometimes he takes most of the birds to Kampala, the capital city, to the Nakasero and Owino markets.

Although each of the members of the group has a separate business, they ensure that they all prosper, and that has kept them together.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for sale.

loans.name: Dia's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Dia A. is a 40 year old married woman with 3 children, ages 20, 20 and 9. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 76. Dia sells clothes, a business she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $700 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in decoration and charcoal selling.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen K., 42, is a widow with three children, and owns a plot of farmland where she grows rice. She typically earns $1 a day. One of her daughters is employed by a garment factory, earning a salary of $80 a month, and one other works as a logger, earning $60 a month. She plans to use the loan from Kiva to expand her business by purchasing good rice seed to grow in the next season. In the future, when she has enough capital she will renovate the house.

loans.use: To purchase good rice seed.

loans.name: Amina's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 19 year old single woman who sells cosmetics, a business she began in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $825 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in retail and cosmetics sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs Suon S., 47, is married with eight children and works as a housewife looking after the children and cooking food for her family members. Her husband, Mr. Sok Chunly, 58, works as a construction worker in his village, which normally earns him $2.90 a day. Three of their daughters are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh city, earning a salary of $60 each a month, while four others are students. This couple aims to use their loan from Kiva to buy sand, iron, and cement to renovate the house.

loans.use: To purchase sand, iron and cement to revovate the house.

loans.name: Lugonda's Group

texts.en:
Fred L. lost his wife on 14th February 2008, leaving him with 13 children to look after, plus 12 grandchildren and seven children from his second wife.

Fred has a drug store he calls L. Family Drug Shop that is doing well, thanks to the loans given to him as part of the L. group.

Each member of the group has a separate business. With Fred's part of the loan, he intends to buy drugs like Fansidar and Panadol for his drug shop.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceuticals for a drug shop.

loans.name: Saing

texts.en: Mrs. Saing H., 54, together with her husband, sells Khmer traditional medicine in their village, making on average $5 a day. They have eight children, three of whom work as construction laborers, earning $3 each a day. To make it easier to sell the traditional medicine door-to-door in their village, they are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motor bike to use for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to deliver and sell medicine door-to-door.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, 40 years old, is a married woman with 5 children, ages 21, 19, 17, 15 and 10. She owns a small pharmacy, a business which she started in 2005. Everyday, Amina works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. to earn a monthly profit of about $115 from her sales.
