loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
"I am Yasmeen B.. I am married and I live with my family in Lahore, Pakistan. I am borrowing a loan from you for my son, who operates an electric store. He sell various items including bulbs, wires etc. Now, he requires a loan to expand his store.

"I have [a] few other women with me who are in need of loans: Saima B. and Basheera B. require these loans for their family's bike sales. Mussarat B. plans to use her share of [the] loan to buy cloth in bulk for her business. Balqees B.’s husband sells auto spare parts. I completely trust all these women and request you to give all of us this loan so that we can improve our household income."

loans.use: Expand electric store and support the other businesses

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 17 and 15. Maria started her tailoring business in 2005. Every day she works from 8.30 am to 6.30 pm at her business.

In the past, Maria took 2 loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and successfully repaid the loans. She now requests a loan to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her tailoring business

loans.name: Fahmeeda's Group

texts.en: "I am a group leader, Fahmeeda B.. I am married and a mother of two sons. One of my sons has a tailoring business and the other is a rickshaw driver. He has been employed as a rickshaw driver by someone for almost a year. Now he feels a need to buy his own rickshaw.  Please lend [to] us for this purpose. I have another friend with me who is in a need of loan: Riffat B. needs this loan for the fixing of her husband’s rickshaw (sic)."

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw and support the other business

loans.name: Bulwa B Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Specioza N.. She has a grocery store and is requesting a loan to start a pay phone business. Specioza is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Specioza makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees and repay the loan. Specioza has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in order to add in business and she paid the loan back on time.

Specioza is joined in her small group by Grace N., Mai N., Sarah L., Sarah N. and Eva B.. Grace N. sells charcoal and wants to purchase more charcoal for sale. Mai N. sells fried snacks and wants a loan to purchase a refrigerator. Sarah L. operates a retail shop and wants to buy another refrigerator. Sarah N. is a decorator and is requesting a loan to purchase more decorations. Eva B. sells charcoal and wants to expand to bulk sales with the loan.

loans.use: To start a public phone business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Asha C., who is married with two children, aged 5 and 10.
In 2007 Asha established a textiles business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of material in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional material and dyes for her textiles business.

loans.name: Bulwa C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Pollin K.. She has a business frying and selling snacks and is requesting a loan to boost her business. Pollin is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 6 children ranging from age 9 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Pollin makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees. Pollin has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in order to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Pollin is joined in her small group by Ruth N., Harriet Z., Elizabeth N., and Ruth N.. Ruth N. has a retail shop and wants to purchase a refrigerator. Harriet Z. has a pharmacy and wants a loan to purchase more drugs to sell. Elizabeth N. raises poultry and sells vegetables and wants to purchase more poultry feed. Ruth N. is a tailor and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth and fabric.

loans.use: To add in snack business

loans.name: Ume Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Ume Kalsoom B.. I am from the second largest metropolis, Lahore, in Pakistan. My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) driver and my son runs an auto rickshaw workshop. Last year my son bought some tools with the loan I acquired for him from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Currently I need another loan for his business so that he can buy various other tools for his workshop. My husband‘s income is not steady and my son is the main breadwinner of our family. The other women in my loan group are: Nargis B. [who] manufactures toys; and Rafia B. [who] operates a beauty salon."

There are two other women in the group as well. Ghazala B. wants to buy cloth for her clothing sales business. Maqsoodan B.’s husband wants to buy an additional bike for his motorbike rental. She would like a loan to help him do so.

All of these women work to improve the lives of their children and hope that their children will get new opportunities, which will allow them to avoid the suffering their mothers had to endure.

loans.use: Expand the workshop, buy more tools and support the remaining businesses

loans.name: Butebe A(I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She has a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more food. Ruth is 30 years old and single. She has 2 children aged 1 and 3. With the extra profits from her loan, Ruth hopes to be able to expand her business.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Hasifah N., Jane N., Harriet W., and Fill N.. Hasifah N. has a craft business and wants to add to her business. Jane N. has a local brewery and wants a loan to increase her working capital. Harriet W. operates a retail shop and wants to purchase more shop items. Fill N. has a craft business and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add supplies and furniture to a restaurant

loans.name: Butebe A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Janet K.. She has a craft business and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Janet is 40 years old and is single. She has 2 children, ages 18 and 20, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Janet hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

Janet is joined in her small group by Cissy B., Christine N., Rose N., and Robinah N.. Cissy B. sells used clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Christine N. has a grocery store and wants a loan to purchase a refrigerator. Rose N. sells charcoal and wants to expand to bulk selling. Robinah N. has a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more furniture and utensils.

loans.use: To improve her craft business

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Theresia M., who is married with four children, aged 4, 8, 13, and 15.
In 2007 Theresia established a seamstress business, and now requests a loan of $275  in order to purchase additional stocks of material in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of material in bulk for her seamstress business.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
A. Habil is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Aghdam. He is married and has 3 children. Habil makes money for living from the small garage that you see on photo. He is an expert mechanic and a retailer at the same time. Some of his clients offer him cheap used cars that need to be fixed. So, after buying these cars, he purchases used spare parts and fixes what needs to be fixed. His garage neighbor, Zaur, doesn’t charge Habil for painting his cars. This way, Habil reduces his expenses to a minimum, which gives him greater income.

He needs this loan to buy some new spare parts for the car he purchased a week ago because it is sometimes difficult to find specific used spare parts.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for auto repair and reselling business

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 39 years old and is married with 4 children, ages18,16,14, and 8. Zainabu owns a food shop, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7.30 am to 9.30 pm at her business and can earn about $140 profit a month from her sales.

In the past, Zainabu successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now requests a loan to buy more food items to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell in her shop

loans.name: Butebe A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Goretti N.. She has a local brewing business and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Goretti is 38 years old and is single. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 6 who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Goretti hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Goretti is joined in her small group by Hadija B., Annet N., Patricia Y., and Alice Z.. Hadija B. has a craft business and wants to boost her business. Annet N. is currently operating a beauty salon and wants a loan to purchase more hair oils and chemicals. Patricia Y. operates a local brewery and wants to add more working capital. Alice Z. has beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more jerrycans of local brew to sell

loans.name: Butebe A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Oliver N.. She has a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase more salon equipment. Oliver is 38 years old and is single. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 6, who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Oliver hopes to be able to re-invest in business.

Oliver is joined in her small group by Kevin A., Florence N., Sarah N., and Hanifa N.. Kevin A. sells charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Florence N. operates a bar and wants a loan to purchase more crates of beer. Sarah N. operates a craft business and wants to expand her business. Hanifa N. is a hairdresser and is requesting a loan to purchase a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a daughter named Ira. She lives in Novomoskovsk and sells newspapers and magazines in the local bus station. Her vending stand has a large variety of publications which attract many potential customers. Her trade has been characterized by stable growth over the past 8 years. Presently, her net profit is about $400 a month.

Today, Tatyana is requesting a loan of $500 to increase her assortment of inventory. This financial assistance will help her to improve her sales and grow her business as a result. Not only will it allow Tatyana to obtain necessary inventory and attract more customers, but it will also help her to meet the needs of her family and provide a better livelihood for them.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Asha's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Asha is 34 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 16,14,11,7 and 4. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 12 and 9. Asha owns a food vendor store, which she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena D. is married with one son. She lives in Novomoskovsk with her family and sells women’s lingerie and terrycloth bath robes in the central city market. A nice variety of inventory attracts many potential customers to Yelena’s vending kiosk. Her business has been characterized by stability and consistent growth. Yelena has been in this trade for 5 years. Currently, her profit is about $300 a month.

Yelena would like to invest this loan of $600 in the purchase of additional inventory for further retail sale. She believes the loan will help her to further develop her business and boost her sales. Yelena hopes that the selection of goods she will have available to sell will be very helpful at this stage in her business development when it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to establish a good reputation and attract even more customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a divorced mother of two daughters, ages 23 and 28, who supports herself with a little clothing and accessories business. She started her business selling at the market about eleven years ago at a time when she needed work. She currently has an attractively arranged kiosk at the busy central market in Zhidachev in western Ukraine. Tatyana is a dedicated, hard-working entrepreneur. Other than to pay off some bills and continue to support herself, her goals include being able to see her daughters get established in life.

Tatyana has requested a short term loan of $500 to purchase a new inventory of accessories for her business. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Tatyana as she works to provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Florentina K.,  who is married with four children, aged 4, 8, 13, and 15.

In 2006 Florentina established a seamstress business, and now requests a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional stocks of material in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase material in bulk for her seamstress business.

loans.name: Asha's Tumaini. Group

texts.en:
Asha A. is 52 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 30 and 14. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people aged 70 and 16. Asha owns a small shop, which she opened in 2000. Everyday, she works from 8am to 1pm at her business.

In the past, Asha took out 2 loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and successfully repaid those loans. She now requests a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses selling cloth, a cafe, and a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Sonia, Salustia, and Margarita have been members of the community bank “Ollantay II” for close to two years. In the community bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and united. In addition, they have learned about healthy living, how to take care of their children, and family planning techniques.

Sonia is 20 years old. She is currently studying computers. Sonia sells cosmetics from a catalogue. She has been selling her products to friends and family for one year.

Salustia is 24 years old. She lives with her partner and two children. Salustia sells candies from a cart on one of the central streets of Ayacucho. She started this business two years ago with her first loan from the community bank.

The third group member, Margarita, is 37 years old. She lives with her partner and four children. Margarita is an employee at a hostel. Previously, she sold food, but her other job forced her to give that up. With this loan Margarita is planning to start selling food again.

Sonia, Salustia, and Margarita need loans of 200, 400, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy perfumes, crèmes, soft drinks, cookies, candies, chocolates, tables, and plates.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Sonia, Salustia, and Margarita plan to use their savings to finish school, and to build a house. Their dreams are to finish school, study accounting, that their children will be professionals, have a stable business, and they all three dream of owning a home.

loans.use: to purchase various goods for their small businesses

loans.name: Taku Liguèye De Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Having had the benefit of an initial loan, which we shared among thirty or so people, we decided this time to create a smaller group so that we could start up a sustainable business with a limited number of members. On this occasion we want to make a business of forest and fishing products that we intend to buy from producers and resell in town or at village fairs that take place every week around our village. Through SEM and Kiva we have been able to pursue activities that have brought us a small income and this time we hope to do better. 

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Après avoir bénéficié d'un premier prêt, que nous avons partagé entre une trenteine de personnes, nous avons décidé pour cette fois ci de créer un groupe restreint pour pouvoir mettre sur pied une entreprise durable avec un nombre limité de membre.
Pour cette fois-ci nous voulons faire du commerce de produits forestiers et halieutiques que nous comptons acheter chez les producteurs et ensuite les revendre en ville ou dans les foires villageoises qui s'organisent toutes les semaines autour de notre village.
Grâce au SEM et à Kiva nous avons pû faire des activités qui nous ont rapporté un peu d'économie et pour cette fois, nous espèrons faire mieux.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and forest products

loans.name: Abasi Songambele Group

texts.en:
Abasi Mutindi, age 25, is married with one child of 4 years. He is a market seller. He began this business 4 years ago. He works from 8am to 9pm daily and has managed to make a monthly profit of around US$ 54.40.

In the past, Abasi has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy furniture. He hopes for a new loan to xpand his business and to start selling charcoal .He will share this loan with his subgroup members dealing in market sales and food sellers.

In the picture Abasi is 1st from right - back row.

loans.use: to  start up a charcoal business

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Donata M., who is married with two children, aged 9 and 13.
In 2005 Donata established a tailoring supplies business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of material, lining, glue, and other sewing accessories. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of material, lining, glue, and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Diama 2 Group

texts.fr:
After our initial experience selling spare parts for bicycles, we realized that this activity is very promising, as the number of customers coming to us has not stopped increasing and demand has indicated that we should rent out all-terrain bicycles to tourists who are passing through and wish to visit the surrounding villages by bicycle. This requires an investment in order to buy quality equipment. For this reason we have come to SEM and Kiva so that our Group can address this situation.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Après une première expèrience dans le domaine de la revente de pièces détachées pour bicyclettes, nous nous sommes rendus compte que cette activité est très prometteuse, car le nombre de clients qui viennent nous solliciter ne cesse de s'accroître et la demande voudrait aussi que nous mettons sur place une unité de location de vélo tout terrain pour les touristes qui sont de passage et qui souhaitent faire le tour des villages environnants à vélo. Ce qui fait qu'un besoin en investissement pour s'équiper en matériels de qualité s'impose. C'est pour cela que nous nous adressons à SEM et à Kiva pour que cette situation puisse être prise en charge par notre Groupe.

loans.use: To buy bicycles and spare parts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Rose L., who is married with two children, aged 4 and 6, and has one other dependent, her younger brother.
In 2001 Rose established a pharmacy business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to add to her inventory of medicines. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of medicines at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Kitimbwa Mixed Group

texts.en:
Rose N., age 34, is the chairperson of Kitimbwa Mixed group. She is married with seven children and also looks after two kids that belong to her siblings. She has a retail shop in Kitimbwa, a trading center outside of Kayunga town. She usually buys goods from the wholesale shops in Kayunga and sells them in her shop, and so far her shop is prospering.

A previous loan enabled Rose to do more than just pay her children’s school fees and pay her rent. In addition, she has expanded her business to include farming; with the help of her husband, she runs a coffee and maize plantation. With this loan, she plans to restock her shop by buying sugar, soap, salt, and petroleum jelly. She hopes that this will increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, salt, and petroleum jelly for her shop

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Salima S., who is married with two children, aged 5 and 8. In 2005 Salima established a café, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and oil in bulk.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her cafe in bulk, including oil, rice, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nsamba's Group

texts.en:
A teacher by profession, Joseph N. is also a businessman. He teaches mathematics and science in Lugasa Primary School in Kitimbwa. Though he loves his job, he saw that the income from it was not enough to meet all his needs. So he opened a retail shop, which his wife manages during the day and he takes over at night.

Joseph has been our client for one and a half years, and his previous loans helped him to buy goods for the shop. With this loan, he plans to buy a popcorn machine so he can sell popcorn to his customers. He will station the popcorn machine outside his shop.

loans.use: To buy a popcorn machine for his shop

loans.name: Kabonkétor Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of women wishing to produce clothing from traditional dyed cloth. We have a great deal of experience in this, having been trained in the field. Our work consists of creating and designing traditional dyed 'pagnes' (a length of cloth worn around the waist as a skirt), and making sheets and table cloths to sell to hotels in the region. Our products are much in demand locally as well as in Senegal's cities. At the moment we have a major order to fulfill and it is to address this situation that we come to you with our request for an SEM loan through Kiva.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui désire travailler dans la production d'habits en pagne teité. Nous avons une grande expèrience en la matière car ayant bénéficiée d'une formation dans le domaine. Notre travaille consiste à la création et au design de pagnes teintés , la fabrication de draps et autres nappes de table que nous fournissons aux hotels du département et que nos produits sont très demandés dans la marché local et dans les grandes villes du Sénégal. Ces temps-ci, nous devons livrer une commande très importante et c'est pour povoir faire face à cette situation que nous sommes venues vous solliciter pour avoir accés à un prêt de SEM chez Kiva.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for dyeing cloth and batiks

loans.name: Nakanjako's Group

texts.en:
Milly N., age 45, lost her husband and was left to care for her two sons single-handedly, as well as for three children that belonged to her late brother. If it were not for the retail shop that she has had for five years, things would have been worse. She sells general merchandise that she buys from wholesale shops in Kayunga.

With the help of previous loans, she has been able to restock the shop. She has used her earnings to pay her sons’ school fees, and both of them now have diplomas in engineering. Her dream is to generate more income by completing the construction of the unfinished commercial building that her husband left in Kayunga. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy bread, sugar, biscuits, and salt for her shop.

loans.use: To buy bread, sugar, biscuits, and salt for her shop

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol is a mother who works diligently every day to cover educational expenses for her five younger children. When three of her children entered the police academy and her oldest daughter was completing her teaching, her husband’s salary could not cover all of the necessary expenses; due to this lack of funds, Marisol began selling socks at fairs across the city, which proved to be very helpful and profitable. Since it’s a traveling business, Marisol leaves every weekend to sell her socks in other cities as well. She is very pleased with this as sales have been very good this year and she has been able to fulfill the needs of her dear children who are struggling to become excellent professionals. This exemplary mother seeks your help to expand the reach of her business and invest more capital to offer additional items.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Marisol, es una madre de familia que día a día trabaja diligentemente para cubrir los gastos educativos de sus cinco menores hijos. El sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para toda la inversión que se tenia que hacer cuando tres de sus hijos ingresaron a la escuela de policías y su hija mayor estaba haciendo sus trámites de titulación, después de haber concluido sus estudios de pedagogía; la situación de carencia obligó a Marisol a empezar a vender calcetines en las ferias de la ciudad, esta actividad resultó ser de mucha ayuda y muy rentable, debido a que el negocio es realizado de manera ambulante, Marisol sale cada fin de semana a otras ciudades a venderlas también; está muy satisfecha con este hecho ya que las mismas han sido muy buenas este año y han podido colmar las peticiones de sus queridos hijos quienes luchan por convertirse en excelentes profesionales.Esta ejemplar madre de familia solicita vuestra ayuda para ampliar su radio de acción e invertir mayor cantidad de capital para ofertar otros artículos.

loans.use: Increased capital to offer greater quantity and variety of items.

loans.name: Bagnil Ebourouwaye Group

texts.fr:
There is no grocery store in our village selling the products people need. We have therefore decided to create a minimarket in order to address this situation. Our group has in fact created a small store that will provide jobs to the young women who have remained in the village. It is for this reason that we are asking SEM to help us via its collaboration with Kiva, whose activity we know extends throughout Senegal. We hope our request will be successful. This funding will enable us to save some money in order to meet the needs of ourselves and our families.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dans notre village, il n'existe pas d'épicerie pour la redistributions de produits dont les gens ont besoin. C'est pourquoi nous avons décidé de créer une petite superette afin de palier à ce manquement. Notre groupe a en effet créé une boutique qui va donner de l'emploi à des jeunes filles qui sont restées au village. C'est pour cela que nous demandons au SEM de nous venir en aide grâce à la colaboration qu'il a avec Kiva, dont nous savons que leur activité s'étend partout au Sénégal.Nous espèrons que notre demande aura une suite. Ce financement nous permettra de faire des économies pour subvenir à nos besoins et ceux de nos familles.

loans.use: To buy stock for a grocery store

loans.name: Linda Malengo Group

texts.en:
Linda Masawe, age 37, is married with two children (ages 11 and 5). She has a pharmacy which she began 3 years ago. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 349.

In the past, Linda has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more medicines and open a laboratory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses in selling sarongs, running a hotel, seling fish, running a beauty salon and working as market sellers.

In the picture Linda is in the middle, front row

loans.use: to buy more medicines and open a laboratory

loans.name: Mirna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mirna is a small merchant. She sells a variety of clothing, lingerie and cosmetics in the streets. She is a 53 year old single mother with 2 children, both now grown. She lives in the housing development Laureles Norte, a semi-rural, poor neighborhood where basic services such as water and, often, electricity scarcely exist. This mother launched her business more than 20 years ago, which allowed her to moved her children and family ahead, despite the difficult economic situation in which she found herself.

At the moment Mirna lives with her daughter who helps her with the household errands and in the business: The have both worked at marketing the products and they have a good number of steady clients. Mirna sells on credit and currently she is expanding her offer to include shoes for men and women. With the support that she receives from her daughter this mother has been constructing her home. Her wish is to set up a store in her home so that she wiil no longer have to walk through the streets offering her products; she is afraid she may be robbed. At the moment she needs a loan to buy children's clothing and also women's lingerie, one of the products that sells most rapidly.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Mirna es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica a vender ropa variada, ropa interior y cosméticos de manera ambulante, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, ambos son mayores de edad, habita en el asentamiento “Laureles Norte”, este es un barrio semi-rural, pobre, existe escasez de algunos servicios básicos como el agua y muchas veces luz. Esta madre emprendió su negocio hace más de 20 años, el cual le permitió sacar adelante a sus hijos, pese a la difícil situación económica en la que se encontraba.

En estos momentos vive con su hija la cual le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y le apoya en el negocio, ambas se han dedicado a comercializar los productos, cuentan con un buen número de clientes fijos, vende al crédito y actualmente se esta expandiendo ya que esta ofreciendo zapatos para dama y caballeros. Con la remesa que recibe de su hijo esta madre ha ido levantando su vivienda. El deseo de la señora es el de montar una tienda en su vivienda para ya no andar en la calle ofreciendo sus productos, ya que teme que le roben. En estos momentos necesita un préstamo para comprar ropa para niños y ropa interior para dama, ya que es una de las cosas que más rápido se venden.

loans.use: Purchase women's lingerie and children's clothing

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia is 55 years old. She lives in the housing development Laureles Norte with her husband and 2 children. Roughly 2 years ago she launched her own business. Her husband works as a taxi driver. They put a small restaurant in their home, where she offers a variety of homemade meals. Silvia tends to the restaurant every day of the week. She has a good number of clients, many of whom work in the surrounding area. Currently the business is the family's main source of income; it has allowed them to live with dignity. Silvia wishes to expand her business, offering a pleasant and tranquil atmosphere to her clients. At the moment, she is requesting a loan with which to purchase basic ingredients, vegetables and condiments, all to be used in the preparation of the dishes she serves to her clients. She will also buy 2 plastic tables with matching chairs in order to offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Silvia tiene 55 años, habita en el asentamiento Laureles Norte con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. La señora aproximadamente hace 2 años emprendió su negocio. Su esposo se desemP. como taxista. Es así como en su pequeña vivienda, decide poner un comedor en el cual ofrece una variedad de comida casera, el cual atiende todos los días de la semana, posee un buen numero de clientes, muchos trabajan en los alrededores de la zona y son quienes mayormente degustan de los platillos que elabora la señora. Actualmente, el negocio es la mayor fuente de ingresos con que cuenta esta familia y les ha permitido vivir dignamente. El deseo de la señora es de expandir su negocio, ofreciendo un ambiente agradable y tranquilo para todos sus clientes. En estos momentos, la señora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar granos básicos, verduras y condimentos, que requiere para la elaboración de los platillos alimentos y 2 juegos de mesas con sillas plásticas, en el cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes

loans.use: Buy raw materials such as oil, beans, meat ,etc. in order to invest in her restaurant.

loans.name: Awkiyo Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of young people living in the ecovillage of Oussouye who wish to obtain funding from Kiva to create businesses that will generate income and give us stable and sustainable jobs. We will also help combat clandestine immigration and promote jobs for young people. We have chosen a field of work that is in keeping with local needs, particularly as Oussouye has no suppliers of poultry meat. We therefore plan to address this situation through the support of SEM, which is our only development partner. We thus hope to benefit from Kiva funds in order to pursue our activity.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes personnes qui habite l'écovillage d'oussouye et nous souhaitons avoir un fiancement auprès de Kiva pour créer des activités génératrices de revenu afin de pouvoir avoir des emplois stables et durables. Nous contibuirons aussi à la lutte contre l'immigration clandestine et promouvoir l'emploi des jeunes.Nous avons choisi un travail qui cadre avec les besoins des populartions, d'autant plus que la ville d'Oussouye n'a pas de fournisseurs en viande de volailles. nous comptons donc faire face à cette situation grâce à l'appui du SEM qui est notre principale et unique partenaire de développement. Ainsi donc nous espèrons bénéficier des fonds de Kiva pour faire notre activité.

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed and poultry-farm equipment

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đặng Thị Định is 40 years old. She runs a restaurant for the last 5 years. Her restaurant serves breakfast to local villagers. She is a pleasant hostess so it explains why her restaurant is always busy. Her family income is 250 USD a month. Mrs Định is married and has 3 children. They all live in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Her husband is a farmer. Their children go to school and help her out in their free time. The school fees and related expenses are high because 2 of her children are in their final years. Mrs Định is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand her restaurant, renew the menu to attract more customers. She is in her 7th year as a TYM member

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Định, 40 tuổi, làm nghề bán hàng ăn được 5 năm nay. Chị chuyên bán đồ ăn sáng phục vụ cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Thái độ phục vụ vui vẻ nhiệt tình nên cửa hàng của chị Định lúc nào cũng đông khách. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình chị là 250USD. Chị Định đang sống cùng chồng, một nông dân, cùng 3 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Các con chị đều đã lớn nên ngoài thời gian đi học cũng hộ trợ được mẹ rất nhiều. Hai cháu đang học những năm cuối cấp nên chi phí cũng khá tốn kém. Chị Định rất muốn vay 1200USD từ Quỹ để mua thêm thực phẩm, thu hút thêm khách hàng, mở rộng hàng ăn lớn hơn. Chị Định là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương.

loans.use: Expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hoàng Thị L., 34, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. She is married and has 2 children: 1 son and 1 daughter, both go to school. She used to brew liquor and sell to restaurants and locals. Then she opened an internet cafe 2 years ago. Since the local economy is going well , people need communication so internet usage has increased. Her cafe is busy. Her monthly revenue is 180 USD. Her husband is a hard working farmer, he often helps her out with errants. She's requesting a L. of 950 USD to buy new computers thus increasing her income in the long run.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị L., 34 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Hai con chị, 1 trai, 1 gái, đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước đây công việc chính của chị L. là nấu rượu cung cấp cho người dân và quán ăn trong vùng. Hai năm trở lại đây chị vay vốn kinh doanh dịch vụ internet. Kinh tế địa phương phát triển nhu cầu thông tin người dân cao nên cửa hàng thường xuyên có khách. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng từ cửa hàng là 180USD. Chồng chị L. là một người nông dân chịu khó và thường xuyên giúp đỡ vợ trong mọi công việc. Sắp tới chị muốn được vay thêm 950USD từ Quỹ Tình thương để mua thêm máy, tăng doanh thu cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Thư, 35 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children, 7 and 2, in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Her family has a construction material business for 5 years now. It is a good business. The monthly income is steady at around 300USD. She is applying for a loan of 1,200USD to stock more material.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Thư, 35 tuổi, sống cùng chồng tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chị có 2 con, cháu đầu 7 tuổi, cháu út 2 tuổi. Nghề chính của gia đình chị là kinh doanh nguyên vật liệu xây dựng. Gia đình chị làm công việc này đến nay được 5 năm. Trong xu thế phát triển chung, nhiều công trình xây dựng được khởi công nên hàng của gia đình chị luôn bán chạy và được giá. T. nhập mỗi tháng của gia đình chị là 300USD. Nhận thấy đây là một nghề có xu hướng phát triển mạnh trong tương lai, chị Thư tiếp tục vay vốn đầu tư cho dự án. Số vốn chị định vay ở vòng tới là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy iron, steel

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lịch, 50 years old, is a fifth year member of the TYM Fund. Her husband died almost 10 years ago, she’s tried very hard to raise 3 children singly. The two older ones have jobs, the youngest is still in college. The family farms a half acre rice paddy and she tends a herd of dozen plus pigs. She also brews rice wine and use the by product as feed for her pigs. She would like to stay with the Fund as long as possible. This time she is applying for a loan of 1,200USD to buy piglets. The average monthly income is 250USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Lịch, 50 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng mất từ gần 10 năm trước, gia đình chị chỉ có 4 mẹ con. Để có thể nuôi các con trưởng thành được như hôm nay là một sự cố gắng lớn của chị Lịch. Ngoài làm 6 sào ruộng, trong chuồng nhà chị lúc nào cũng có một đàn lợn hơn chục con. Để tiết kiệm chi phí thức ăn, chị làm thêm nghề nấu rượu, vừa thuận lợi cho việc trả tuần vừa có thể tận dụng cám bã làm thức ăn gia súc. Đến nay hai người con lớn của chị đã có việc làm, con út đang học đại học. Mong muốn của chị Lịch là được tham gia Quỹ lâu dài và được vay vốn đầu tư sản xuất. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 1200USD mua lợn giống. Thu nhập bình quân của chị Lịch là 250USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Mộc, 54 years old, lives in Lương Bằng, Kim Động. She has 2 children. Both are grown up and one has moved out. She has a shoe store. It has been 5 years now. The store is popular and always crowded. The monthly income is 200USD. This time she is applying for a loan of 950USD to stock her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Mộc, 54 tuổi, sống tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, huyện Kim Động. Nghề nghiệp chính của chị là bán hàng giầy, dép. Chị làm công việc này đã được 5 năm nay. Hàng bán ra chất lượng, giá cả phải chăng nên cửa hàng chị Mộc luôn đông khách. Mức thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng là 200USD/tháng. Hai con của chị Mộc đều đã trưởng thành, một cháu ra ở riêng. Gánh nặng gia đình được giảm bớt, chị Mộc có nhiều thời gian dành cho công việc kinh doanh hơn trước kia. Bán hàng vừa mang lại thu nhập vừa mang lại niềm vui cho chị qua việc tiếp xúc với khách hàng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay thêm 950USD để mua thêm nhiều hàng về bán.

loans.use: Buy shoes, sandals

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 34 years old, lives with her husband and two school age children, 15 and 9, in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Her main occupation is brewing rice wine and tending pigs. She is good at pig tending for sure. Each year, she releases prime pigs 3 or 4 times. Each earns her about 1,000USD. Subtracting all expenses the net income is about 200USD a month. She’s been with the TYM Fund for 5 years now and has never missed a single payment. This time, she is applying for a loan of 1,200USD to expand business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 34 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Hai con chị T. đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học, cháu lớn 15, cháu nhỏ 9 tuổi. Công việc chính của chị T. là nấu rượu và chăn nuôi lợn. Nhờ mát tay nên đàn lợn của chị lúc nào cũng béo tốt khoẻ mạnh. Mỗi năm chị xuất chuồng 3-4 lứa, mỗi lứa T. trên dưới 1000USD. Trừ chi phí T. nhập bình quân một tháng của gia đình đạt 200USD. Trong 5 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình thương chị chưa bao giờ chậm trễ trong việc hoàn trả hàng tuần. Vòng vốn này chị T. xin vay mức 1200USD để mở rộng chăn nuôi, tăng T. nhập.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 45 years old, a tenth year member of the Kim Động 4th branch of the TYM Fund. She lives with her husband and 2 children. The family has a small patch of farm land that is planted with orange trees. It results a quality production of fruits. Each season would earn 1,000USD for her family. She also raises a half dozen of pigs for extra income. She tries everything for her children who both are in college. This time she is applying for a loan of 1,200USD to buy fertilizer and feed for pigs. The monthly income is 300USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 45 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 10 của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 4 Kim Động. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con. Diện tích đất của gia đình được chị T. cùng chồng tận dụng trồng hơn 3 sào cam. Nhờ kinh nghiệm tích lũy và tích cực chăm bón, vườn cam nhà chị T. luôn cho năng suất cao. Cam nhà chị lại ngọt nên đông khách đặt mua. Mỗi vụ gia đình chị thu hơn 1000USD từ vườn cam. Ngoài ra chị T. còn chăn nuôi 5-6 con lợn để tăng thêm thu nhập. Dù vất vả nhưng nghĩ đến tương lai của các con khi ra trường có công ăn việc làm khiến chị quên đi những mệt mỏi trong công việc hàng ngày. Hai con của chị T. hiện đang học cao đẳng, đại học trên thành phố. Vòng vốn này chị T. xin vay 1200USD để mua phân bón thức ăn gia súc. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của gia đình là 300USD.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and feed for pigs

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte M. is 32 years old, married to a carpenter, and has 2 children. She is a businesswoman who sells drinks. She is requesting a loan of $425 to buy drinks in bulk at a discount. 90+ degree weather, year-round, makes for many thirsty Ghanaians.

Charlotte is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To drinks in bulk at a discount for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Vĩnh, 46, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. She is a TYM member since 2002. She is married and has 2 children, all grown up and are working in construction. Beside working on her rice paddy, she also raises pigs. She has more than 10 experience in raising pigs, her pigs are healthy and meaty. As soon as she sells one batch of pigs, she has another batch of piglets to replace. Each batch of pigs brings her 1000 USD. Her husband and children chip in to help her making the weekly payments. Her family monthly income is 250 USD. She made a good profit from the sale of her last batch so her family did have a sumptuous Tet holiday. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy breeding pigs and mash for.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Vĩnh, 46 tuổi, sống tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 người con đã trưởng thành. Ngoài làm ruộng, công việc chính của chị Vĩnh là chăn nuôi lợn. Với kinh nghiệm hơn 10 năm trong việc chăn nuôi, đàn lợn của chị lúc nào cũng béo tốt, khoẻ mạnh. Lứa này xuất chuồng lại có lứa khác thay thế. Mỗi lần xuất chuồng, chị Vĩnh thu trên dưới 1000USD. Việc hoàn trả hàng tuần do chồng và các con đi làm xây dựng hỗ trợ. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình là 250USD. Số tiền bán lợn vừa rồi giúp chị Vĩnh có một cái Tết tươm tất hơn mọi năm. Vòng vốn này chị Vĩnh xin vay 1200USD để mua lợn giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy breeding pigs, mash

loans.name: Quach Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Quach Thi H. is 29 years old. She lives with her husband (38 years old) and two children, one boy, one girl. She has joined TYM Fund (Kiva partner in Vietnam) for 5 years. Her main job is to sell fruit and candy. This is a pretty popular job in her village. Mrs. H. chose this job because she can easily get money and pay back the weekly payments, while she is still able to stay at home with her kids. Each day she earns about 4 to 5USD from this little grocery store. Her husband, Nguyen Van That, opened a motorbike/bicycle repair shop right next to her store. In the free time, he often helps her with her work. Mrs. H. family is very happy. Her wish is to continue to borrow from TYM Fund to buy more goods for her grocery store. This time she wants to borrow 950USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Quách Thị Huệ năm nay 29 tuổi, còn chồng chị 38 tuổi, họ có 2 cháu, 1 trai, 1 gái. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương được đến nay được 5 năm. Công việc chính của chị Huệ là bán hàng hoa quả, bánh kẹo. Đây là một nghề phổ biến với người dân trong vùng. Chị Huệ chọn công việc này vì vừa thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả tuần vừa tạo thu nhập thường xuyên lại có điều kiện ở nhà chăm con nhỏ. Tiền lãi hàng ngày từ cửa hàng khoảng 4-5USD. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Thất, mở một quầy sửa xe ngay cạnh cửa hàng tạp hóa của gia đình. Những lúc rảnh rỗi anh là người phụ giúp đắc lực cho vợ trong việc bán hàng. Cuộc sống của hai vợ chồng thật hạnh phúc. Mong muốn của chị Huệ là tiếp tục được vay vốn từ Quỹ để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho người dân. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị lần này là 950USD.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi H., 29 years old, opened a clothing store five years ago. This is the main job of her family members. Her husband often helps her with the business. Selling clothes is a developing, popular job not only in Kim Dong province but also in others. Each month, her net income is 3000USD. "but this job requires a lot of liquidity", said H.. That's why Mrs. H. joined TYM Fund in 2006. After 2 years, she borrowed 1000USD from TYM. Now she would like to borrow 575USD to buy more inventories. This is winter so her winter clothes is in demand. Mrs. H. has two young children, one is 5 and one is 2.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hằng, 29 tuổi, mở cửa hàng kinh doanh quần áo cách đây được 5 năm. Đây là nghề chính của gia đình, chồng chị thường xuyên hỗ trợ vợ trong việc kinh doanh. Nghề kinh doanh hàng quần áo đang là một nghề rất phát triển không những tại Kim Động mà còn ở nhiều địa phương khác. Thu nhập một năm của gia đình chị Hằng sau khi trừ chi phí khoảng 3000USD. Chị Hằng tâm sự, với nghề này thì gia đình chị lúc nào cũng cần đến nguồn vốn vay. Do vậy, năm 2006 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương. Trong 2 năm qua chị đã vay tổng số vốn của Quỹ là 1000USD. Hiện nay, chị đang đề nghị Quỹ cho vay mức vốn 575USD để mua thêm hàng về bán. Thời điểm này đang có đợt rét đậm nên quần áo rét bán rất chạy. Chị Hằng đã có hai cháu nhỏ 5 và 2 tuổi.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda D. runs a small food stand at Cape Coast Polytechnic School. She cooks traditional Ghanaian food such as “fufu” and “banku”. Her husband is a student at Cape Coast Polytechnic. She is requesting a loan of $525 so she can buy more food products in addition to what she already sells.

Amanda is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more food products

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trinh Thi T., 50 years old, lives in Luong Bang commune in Kim Dong district with her husband and her 5 children. Two of her children are still in school. Besides farming, her main job is to breed pigs. With her ten-year experience in breeding, her farrow of pigs always look healthy and fat. Every 3 or 4 month, she can sell one litter of pigs. At that time her family got a big income. In order to afford the weekly payment, Mrs. T. sells vegetable to earn more money. In difficult times, her husband and her older children also help out to pay the loan. Her family's monthly income is about 250USD. Next loan cycle she wants to borrow 1200USD to buy piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Toán, 50 tuổi, sống tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động cùng chồng và 5 người con. Hai trong số 5 người con của chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Ngoài làm ruộng công việc chính của chị Toán là chăn nuôi lợn. Có kinh nghiệm hơn 10 năm trong việc chăn nuôi nên đàn lợn nhà chị Toán lúc nào trông cũng béo tốt khoẻ mạnh. Cứ 3-4 tháng lại có 1 lứa xuất chuồng. Những lúc đó cả nhà lại có thêm một khoản thu nhập lớn. Để có tiền hoàn trả tuần chị Toán chạy trợ bán rau để kiếm thêm đồng ra đồng vào. Những lúc khó khăn chồng và người con lớn lại hỗ trợ thêm. Thu nhập của cả gia đình chị Toán đạt 250USD/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 1200USD để mua lợn con thay cho đàn lợn mới xuất chuồng trong dịp Tết vừa qua.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
The business man Justo Jiron is 45 years old and is a countryman by origin. He lives in Bluefields, and has 6 children who are all students at the elementary level. As of 10 years ago, he has sold products such as basic grains, fruit juices, sodas and others at his general store. Mr. Jiron lives in a coastal sector at the Bluefield's bay, where only his business and a similar one exist therefore permiting a good amount of business. However, the money he has on is limited, which is why he needs financing to buy the following products: 304 lbs of rice at $8 USD per pound, 202 lbs of sugar at $7 USD per pound, 304 lbs of flour at $8 USD per pound, 3 drums of oil at $31.50 USD per drum, 5 packs of salt at $7.60 USD per pack, 5 boxes of washing soap at $9 USD per box, 5 packs of eggs at $3 USD per pack; 5 boxes of soap at $3 USD per box, and 5 bags of toilet paper at $6.50 USD per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El microempresario Justo Jiron tiene 45 años, es de origen campesino, vive en Bluefields, tiene 6 hijos todos estudian en el nivel primario. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a vender en su pulperia productos tales como granos basicos, refrescos naturales, gaseosas entre otros. El señor Jiron habita en un sector costero a la bahia de Bluefields en donde solamente existen su negocio y otro similar por lo que le permite tener una buena venta. Sin embargo el capital con el que cuenta es poco por lo que necesita un financiamiento para la compra de los siguientes productos: 3 quintales de arroz a US$ 37 dolares cada quintal, 2 quintales de azucar a US$ 27 dolares cada quintal, 3 quintales de harina a US$ 38 dolares cada quintal, 3 bidones de aceite a US$ 31.50 cada bidon, 5 pacas de sal a US$ 7.60 cada paca, 5 cajas de jabon de lavar a US$ 9 dolares cada caja, 5 cajillas de huevo a US$ 3 dolares cada cajilla, 5 cajas de sopa magui a US$ 3 dolares cada caja y 5 bolsones de papel higienicos a US$ 6.50 cada bolson.

loans.use: Purchase 304 lbs of rice, 202 lbs of sugar, 304 lbs of flour, 3 drums of oil, 5 packs of salt, 5 boxes of washing soap, 5 packs of eggs; 5 boxes of soap, and 5 bags of toilet paper.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $42.96 dólares.
La cuota real es de US$ 42.96
La cuota real es de $ 42.96 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 42.96 dólares.
Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi N., 40 years old, currently live with her husband at Bac Phuc commune, Soc Son district. Mrs. N. has been in TYM since 1995. All her previous loans had been used to invest in lifestock breeding and dish-washing service (at weddings and funerals). Since 2000, she has moved into a new business, taking wedding pictures, help the bride with make-up and renting wedding dresses. Her income had increased substantially to 300 dollars per month. In addition, Mr. Thiep, her husband has also been working as security guard at the People's Committee. With a more stable flow of income, they have been able to send their two sons to school throughout the years. Both had done very well and are currently at universities in Hanoi, one at Medical School and the other at The College of Economics. She is very grateful for the help from TYM and would like to continue to be part of the group. This loan cycle, she would like to ask for 1200 USD to buy the photograph's screener and new wedding dresses.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Nghĩa, 40 tuổi, sống cùng chồng tại xã Bắc Phú, huyện Sóc Sơn. Chị Nghĩa tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1995. Các vòng vốn đầu chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và dịch vụ cho thuê bát đĩa phông bạt dùng cho đám hiếu, hỷ. Từ năm 2000 chị chuyển sang nghề chụp ảnh, trang điểm cô dâu, cho thuê áo cưới. Thu nhập kinh doanh có sự thay đổi rõ rệt tăng lên mức 300USD/tháng. Ngoài ra, anh Thiệp, chồng chị còn làm thêm bảo vệ cho UBND xã nên kinh tế gia đình rất ổn định. Kinh tế phát triển, 2 con của anh chị đều được tạo điều kiện cho học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Hai cháu nhiều năm liên tiếp đạt học sinh giỏi, và hiện nay đang theo học đại học Y và đại học Kinh tế trên Hà nội. Nguyện vọng của chị Nghĩa là được tham gia Quỹ lâu dài và mãi mãi. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD để mua phông nền chụp ảnh và váy áo cưới.

loans.use: Buy wedding-dress and background picture

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 47 years old, has been a part of TYM since 2000. She lived with her husband and two grown up children at Tien Duoc commune, Soc Son District. Her first loan cycle was used in breeding pigs and poultry which gave her family decent and stable income but not a lot of changes. In 2003, she moved solely into breeding hens and selling eggs. This business has been giving her higher income and quicker turn around. She can make a profit of 8 to 10 USD daily. Her husband currently work for a paper manufacturing factory nearby and each month come home with 50 USD. Her family total income reach about 300 USD per month. Currently, her business has about 450 chickens. In 2006, they remodel their house and bathroom with cost them 2500 USD. This loan cycle, she whould like to ask for 1200 to buy more of breeding hen and cattle-fed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hưng, 47 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2000. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Họ sống tại xã Tiên Dược, huyện Sóc Sơn. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay 125USD chăn nuôi lợn gà, kinh tế ổn định nhưng chưa thực sự thay đổi rõ nét. Năm 2003 chị chuyển sang chăn nuôi gà đẻ trứng. Nghề này mang lại cho chị Hưng thu nhập cao và thường xuyên. Lượng trứng bán ra mỗi ngày cho thu nhập từ 8-10USD. Chồng chị làm thuê cho xưởng sản xuất giấy cạnh nhà mỗi tháng lương 50USD. Tổng thu nhập của gia đình đạt 300USD/tháng. Hiện tại trong chuồng nhà chị Hưng có khoảng 450 con gà. Năm 2006, anh chị đã xây nhà ngang và công trình phụ trị giá 2500USD. Vòng vốn tới chị Hưng tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD mua gà giống và thức ăn chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy chickens and food for them

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. E. is a teacher and a retailer. He is single and has no children. To supplement his modest teacher's salary, James sells soaps, sugar, corn meal, and other provisions around Cape Coast Polytechnic. He is requesting a loan of $525 to buy a wider variety of soaps and food products for sale.

James is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of soaps and food products for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 25 years old, lives with her husband and her four-year-old child in Bac Phu commune, Soc Son district. Mrs. L. and her husband married in 2002. At that time, they just moved out and realL. needed funds to start their business. She discussed with her husband to join TYM Fund (Kiva's Partner in Vietnam) in order to borrow some money and buy plastic goods to sell in the nearby market and to open a small refreshment/drink store at home. Their business is doing well. Her income increases significantL.. Mrs. L. starts to be able to buy some furniture such as a television and a motorbike. After a while, her husband bought a car wash machine, increasing their famiL. income even more. On average, they earn 270-300USD per month. This time she would like to borrow 1200USD to buy more plastic goods for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lý, 25 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ 4 tuổi tại xã Bắc Phú, huyện Sóc Sơn. Hai anh chị cưới nhau năm 2002. Lúc đó, hai vợ chồng trẻ mới ra ở riêng nên còn thiếu vốn làm ăn. Chị bàn bạc cùng anh xin tham gia Quỹ Tình thương để vay vốn mua đồ nhựa buôn bán tại chợ xã và bán hàng giải khát tại nhà. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên, chị Lý sắm được một số vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình như tivi, xe máy. Sau một thời gian, chồng chị đầu tư thêm máy rửa xe đem lại nguồn thu nhập đáng kể. Bình quân mỗi tháng thu nhập cả gia đình từ 270-300USD. Dự định vòng vốn tiếp theo chị xin vay 1200USD để thêm mua đồ nhựa gia dụng, tăng thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy articles made of plastics

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is in the business of food production and sale. She is a single parent of 6 children. Ama prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’ (a steamed fermented corn dough dish) which is highly patronized by Ghanaians. She wants to increase her sales and meet the needs of her ever increasing clientele.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more corn and other raw materials for her food production.

loans.use: to buy more corn and other raw materials for her food production

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia K. is married and has 3 children. For the past 6 years she has run a small road-side stand selling handbags, sleepware, and other clothing items. She is requesting a loan of $275 to buy additional women’s clothing accessories to attact new customers and increase her client base.

Felicia is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional women’s clothing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Basita

texts.es:
Mrs. Basita E. T. is a partner of the Communal Bank “Picota.” She lives in the region of San Martín, in Picota province and district. Her business is located at Jr. Miguel Grau 375. Basita sells groceries, dresses, shoes, perfume, and office supplies.

With the support of her husband and children and through her own dedication, Basita has managed to expand her business considerably. When she started they had an almost empty shelf, but they now offer a variety of products.

With a loan of S/ 2000 ($700 US), which will be paid back in six months, Basita will buy rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil in cartons, detergents, soaps, general cleaning supplies, soft drinks, diverse candies, and other items in order to supply her business and meet the expectations of her clients. Basita is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her two children, who push her to exert herself every day in order to achieve her well-planned goals. In the future she hopes to have, in addition to a well-stocked store, a place where she could sell pastries, since she loves to cook and to prepare desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Breanna Wong, Kaleigh Ruffner and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

La señora Basita E. T. es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota” vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Miguel Grau 375, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, vestidos, zapatería , perfumería y útiles de escritorio. Con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos y a su dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio solo tenia un andamio casi vació, ahora oferta variedad d productos. Con el crédito recibido de S/.2000.00 el cual pagara en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en bolsas , leche, aceite, en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles de limpieza en general, gaseosas, golosinas diversas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio y cubrir las expectativas de sus clientes. La señora Basita tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día más para lograr y cumplir con sus metas trazadas, desea para el futuro además de su bodega ampliada, un lugar donde pueda vender refrigerios, ya que le encanta cocinar y preparar postres.

loans.use: To expand merchandise and increase sales

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence L. is married to a fire fighter and has 2 children. She has been running her own hair salon for 12 years. She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy hair extensions, hair products and creams. Her clients are demanding certain products, so she will use the loan to meet demand. She hopes this loan will increase her monthly profits.

Florence is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, hair products and creams.

loans.name: Rosa Piedad

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Piedad R. D. D. F.ández is a member of the community bank “Santa Rosa” (Saint Rose) which is located in the district of San José D. Sisa in the province of El Dorado in the San Martín region. She is dedicated to the preparation and sale of food from her own home. She provides daily service to workers in the fields of education, health, agriculture, and other fields.

Her need to give her children a better education motivated her to start her own business. At first, she borrowed cooking utensils and other materials, but later she began acquiring implements with the earnings from her sales.

With a loan of 2500 Peruvian Nuevo sol ($875 US), which she will repay in six months, she will invest in creating her own restaurant, purchasing chairs and tables as well as non-perishables that will be used in the preparation of meals.

Rosa is 38 years old and has three children. Her goal is to have a restaurant where she will be able to sell a variety of dishes from a menu.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Bevington, Alyssa Sanow, and Debra Fraszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

La señora Rosa Piedad R. D. D. F.ández, es socia del Banco Comunal ”Santa Rosa” ubicado en el distrito D. San José D. Sisa, provincia D. El Dorado, departamento D. San Martín, se dedica a la preparación y venta D. comida, dentro D. su propia casa, atendiendo con atención diaria a trabajadores del sector educación, salud, ministerio D. agricultura y otros. La necesidad D. dar una mejor educación a sus hijos la impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio, al principio pedía prestado utensilios D. cocina y otros materiales, luego los fue adquiriendo con las ganancias que le brindo sus ventas. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en el arreglo D. su propio local, implementando con sillas y mesas y en la compra D. insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración D. los platos D. comida. Tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, su meta es tener un restaurante donD. pueda vender variedad D. platos a la carta.

loans.use: To create her own restaurant

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Ramona R. F. is a member of the communal bank “Las Brisas.” She lives in San Martín, which is in the province of Huallaga and the district of Bellavista. She is dedicated to the sale of items that meet basic needs. Her business is located in her house, which is on the corner of Jirones Augusto B. Legui and Miraflores in Bellevista. She has been dedicated to this business for the past 3 years.

With a loan of S/. 1,500 (approximately $525.00 US) that she will pay back in six months, Ramona wants to buy a variety of products to supply her business such as sacks of rice, sugar, and a box of oil. She also wants to buy soft drinks because they sell very well in her hot region. In addition, she wants to buy a small glass cabinet to organize the candy that she sells, since there are lots of children in her neighborhood and kids are the principle customers for those types of products.

Ramona is 24 years old and has 3 daughters. The two younger daughters help with the business. It makes her feel calm and happy that they all work together so that the business and the family will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Gearhart and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers

La señora Ramona R. F. es socia del Banco Comunal “ Las Brisas “ vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincial del Huallaga, distrito de Bellavista, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en un local propio ubicado en su casa en la esquina de los Jirones Augusto B. Leguia y Miraflores en la localidad de Bellavista, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 3 años. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500. que pagara en 6 meses, desea comprar diferentes tipos de productos para surtir su negocio como: sacos de arroz, azúcar , 1 caja de aceite gaseosas ,que por lo caluroso de la zona es el producto que mas se vende, también desea comprar una vitrina de vidrio pequeña para organizar los caramelos que vende ya que por su barrio tiene una buena clientela de niños, que son sus principales clientes en este tipo de productos. Ella tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijas mujeres de las cuales las 2 menores son las que la apoyan con la atención en el negocio y eso hace que ella se sienta mas tranquila y feliz ya que todos colaboran para que el negocio y la familia prosperen

loans.use: To purchase items to supply her store

loans.name: Aydalina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Aydalina is 36 years old and lives with her family in the housing development Laureles Norte, a semi-rural, poor neighborhood where the majority of the population has difficulty satisfying their daily needs. Aydalina's family is made up by her husband, who works as a self-employed truck driver, and their son. Her husband handles the responsibility of providing for the family; he also pays all of the basic services including the family's grocery bills. Two years ago, with her husband's economic support, Aydalina was able to launch her own small business selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics in the street. The income that her business generates has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses. They are a very close family. Together they have been able to progress, always with the objective of offering their young son better quality of life during his developing years, including a decent home. Aydalina's dreams of one day running her store out of fixed premises where she can offer her products in a more secure manner while also caring for her son. This mother's most urgent need at the moment is the need to close the back wall that faces the patio of her home, since it is the only wall still missing. She dreams that her humble home will soon be a more secure place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Aydalina tiene 36 años, habita con su familia en el asentamiento Laureles Norte, el cual es un barrio semi-rural, pobre, en donde la mayoría de la población tiene dificultades en satisfacer las necesidades del día a día. La familia de la señora esta compuesta por su esposo quien trabaja de camionero por cuenta propia, se encarga de proveer al hogar y pagar todos los servicios básicos así como de la alimentación de su pequeño hijo. Con el apoyo económico de su esposo, pudo hace 2 años emprender su pequeño negocio, en el cual ofrece de manera ambulante ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. Los ingresos que le genera dicha actividad le permite apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, son una familia muy unida, juntos han podido salir adelante, todo con el fin de brindarle a su pequeño hijo mejores condiciones de vida en la cual se pueda desarrollar ,así como un hogar digno. El deseo de la señora es el de llegar a tener un local fijo en el cual pueda ofrecer sus productos de manera más segura y al mismo tiempo cuidar de su hijo. La mayor necesidad de esta madre en estos momentos, es el de cerrar el muro de atrás de la vivienda que da con el patio, ya que es la única pared que le falta de construir, lo que más desea es que su humilde vivienda se encuentre segura de habitar.

loans.use: Buy blocks, sand, iron and cement to use in the construction of the rear wall of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more materials for her kitchen

loans.name: Orfita

texts.es:
Mrs. Orfita Gonzáles G. is a partner of the communal bank “Las Brisas.” She lives in the region of San Martín, province of Huallaga, district of Bellavista. She dedicates herself to the sale of food at a shop in her own home on Jr. Alameda Olmedo Cárdenas Infante S/n in Bellavista. She has been in this business for two years.

With a loan of S/ 1,200.00 (approximately US $425) that will be paid over 6 months, Orfita wants to buy construction materials like cement, bricks, and paving stones in order to finish the kitchen of her restaurant. With those improvements, she can bring her clients a more comfortable and hygienic eating facility. She is already well-known in her area for her food’s excellent seasoning.

Orfita is 38 years old and has one small son who is her motivating force for going forward. It is her husband and an additional assistant who help her serve her clients and take care of the chores at home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Gladfelter, Alex Christoff, and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

La señora Orfita Gonzáles G. es socia del Banco Comunal “ Las Brisas” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincial del Huallaga, distrito de Bellavista, se dedica a la venta de comida en un local propio ubicado en su casa en el Jr Alameda Olmedo Cárdenas Infante S/n en la localidad de Bellavista, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 2 años. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 que pagara en 6 meses desea comprar materiales de construcción como:cemento, ladrillos, losetas ,ya que ella desea terminar la cocina de su restaurante y así de esa forma poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y de una forma mas cómoda e higiénica. Ya que ella ya se hizo conocida en la zona por la buena sazón de sus comidas. Ella tiene 38 años y tiene 1 hijo pequeño todavía el cual es su motivo de fuerza para seguir adelante, y es su esposo y un ayudante mas a su cargo los que la ayudan con la atención en su local y con las labores domesticas de la casa.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Mrs. Ada M. R. is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lima.” She lives in the region of San Martín in the province of Huallaga and the district of Bellavista. The business is located in her house at Jiron Bolivar #155. Her store sells general grocery items, candies, and other edible products for daily consumption. She complements her other business by selling beauty products, such as Avon, Unique, and Ebel, which she keeps in stock, as well as purchasing other brands on request.

With a loan of S/.3,000 (approximately $1,050 US), which she will repay in 6 months, Ada will buy rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, boxes of canned fish, eggs, and sweets. She will also buy large quantities of beauty products to make the most of seasonal deals and thus be fully supplied and fill the orders of her strong clientele, which she has developed thanks to her excellent service and perseverance in the industry.

Ada is 58 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She is very grateful to the communal bank for providing her with the opportunity to gain capital and to develop her own small business.

Translated from Spanish by Thomas Daw, Andrew Kirsch, and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

La señora Ada es socia del banco comunal “ Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Huallaga, distrito de Bellavista. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situada en el Jirón Bolivar Nº 155, tiene una bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Complementa el negocio con la venta de productos de belleza de diferentes marcas como Avon, Unique y Ebel de los que tiene productos en stock , como también atiende con pedidos. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará, arroz, azúcar en sacos, leche, aceite, conservas de pescado en cajas, huevos y golosinas, también comprará gran cantidad de productos de belleza aprovechando las ofertas de temporada y así estar abastecida y cumplir con los pedidos de su gran clientela que logro ganar gracias a su buen trato y perseverancia en el trabajo. Ada tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres de sus hijos. Ella se siente agradecida al banco comunal por haberle brindado la oportunidad de tener su propio capital y poder desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria.

loans.use: To purchase groceries (sugar, rice, milk, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es:
Zoila is a single mother and a worthy example of tenacity. She has two minor children and lives in Villa Venezuela. This mother has always searched for the best way to move her family ahead. As much as her economic situation has allowed, she has given her children all they need to live a better quality of life. With a lot of effort she started her business six years ago. She owns a kiosk in a school, where she offers a variety of products and fast food. With the help of her children, she tends to the kiosk and prepares the food that her clients so enjoy. Her clients are the students of morning classes and night classes, as well as the school's teachers.

The kiosk is the only source of income this mother can count on, it has allowed her to cover the family's needs and obligations. At the moment the business needs to be stocked with the products that the children and young people of the school demand daily. She also needs to buy the basic ingredients she uses to prepare the lunches she offers to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoila es madre soltera, digno ejemplo de lucha. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad, habita en Villa Venezuela. Esta madre siempre ha buscado la forma de sacar adelante a sus hijos, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades económicas le ha dado le necesario para que vivan de la mejor manera. Con mucho esfuerzo inició su negocio, el cual ya tiene 6 años de existencia, es un Kiosco Escolar, en donde ofrece una variedad de productos y alimentos rápidos, ella con apoyo de sus hijos se encarga de atender el kiosco y de elaborar la comida que tanto gusta por quienes la consumen, sus clientes son los alumnos del turno matutino y vespertino así como también los maestros del centro escolar.

El kiosco es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta esta madre, el cual le ha permitido cubrir todas las necesidades y obligaciones familiares. En estos momentos el negocio necesita abastecerse de productos que demandan diariamente los niños y jóvenes del colegio, así como también comprar granos básicos que requiere para la elaboración de los almuerzos que ofrece a sus clientes cada día.

loans.use: Buy products to sell in her kiosk

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es:
Mrs. Cadith E. L. is a partner of the communal bank “Honesty and Work”. She lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Caceres and the district of Juanjui. The business is located in her own home, where she sells groceries, soft drinks, and candy. In the same space she has installed 6 computer booths and she also provides telephone service.

With the support of her husband and young children, as well as through her perseverance, Cadith has managed to make the business grow considerably. When it started they had almost empty shelves, but now they offer a variety of products.

With a loan of S/.2,500 (approximately $850 US), which she will repay in 6 months, Cadith will buy groceries like rice, sacks of sugar, oil, cases of milk, soft drinks, candy, and other items in order to supply the business and cover her clients’ needs. Part of the loan will also be invested in cleaning and maintaining the computers.

Mrs. Cadith is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and three children, who motivate her to make an effort each day to reach her objectives. She is an enterprising woman who wants to remodel her house so that she can expand her business to provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Breanna Wong, Kaleigh Ruffner, and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

La señora Cadith E. L. es socia del banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio se ubica en su propia casa donde vende abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas y golosinas. En el mismo ambiente tiene instalado cabinas de Internet, con 6 computadora y también presta servicio de llamadas telefónicas. Con el apoyo de su esposo, el de sus pequeños hijos y su perseverancia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inició sólo tenia un andamio casi vació, ahora oferta variedad productos. Con el préstamo de S/.2,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará abarrotes como arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite y leche en cajas, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros, para surtir el negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
