Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagará en 4 meses comprara 25 juegos de fundas para carros.La señora Adelina sueña con tener un local más amplio en el que pueda exhibir más sus productos.

loans.use: Merchandise (carseat covers) for her business

loans.name: Almacia

texts.es:
Two years ago Almacia was abandoned by her significant other and was left alone with her 4 year old son. It was difficult for her to recover. Still she had the strength of character to get ahead and her business selling natural products was a great help for her and her child. Now her son has been her motivation for progress and she shows great affection for him through her dedication and success in her work. She would like to expand and improve her business and renovating and remodeling her store will be a beneficial factor in her business. With this purpose in mind she is asking for your support to start improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Almacia, tuvo que afrontar el abandono de su pareja hace 2 años y al quedarse sola con su hijo de 4 años fue muy difícil reponerse. Sin embargo tuvo la entereza de salir adelante y el negocio de venta de productos naturistas fue una gran ayuda para ella y su hijo ahora su pequeño se ha convertido en el único motivo de su progreso y demuestra el gran cariño por él, a través de la dedicación y surgimiento en su trabajo.Ella desea ampliar y mejorar su negocio y el renovar o remodelar su tienda seria un gran factor beneficioso para su negocio, con este propósito en mente solicita vuestro apoyo para poner en marcha su propósito.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve the conditions in her workplace

loans.name: Ursulina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Ursulina is 50 years old, and lives with her husband and their fifteen-year-old son in the Enrique Smith neighborhood. Her husband supports the household economically, but it has been her business that generates greater income and with which they are able to deal with covering the family's needs. Their neighborhood location is central and highly traveled, so you find a lot of businesses that provide services or create goods. That's why Ursulina decided to start her business five years ago, which consists of selling quick lunches to the workers in the area and satisfying her customers' demands for ready-to-go food. At the same time, she sells fried foods at nights, and soups on weekends. Ursulina's diner has been very profitable, and she has gotten a good number of customers that are pleased with the delicious, varied, and economical food that she provides. The fruit of her labors has been her ability to get her family ahead. Currently, the price of the products that she uses in her business has gone up and they have become difficult to obtain. She's asking for a loan so that she can buy whole grains, meat, and vegetables that she needs every day for making her food.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Ursulina tiene 50 años de edad, habita con su esposo y su hijo de 15 años de edad en el barrio Enrique Smith. El señor le apoya económicamente en los gastos del hogar, pero ha sido el negocio de la señora el que le genera mayores ingresos y con el cual puede hacer frente a cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. La ubicación donde se encuentra el barrio es muy céntricas y transitada, ya que se encuentran muchas empresas que brindan servicios y/o elaboran bienes, es así como la señora decide emprender su negocio hace 5 años, el cual consiste en vender comida casera (almuerzos) a los trabajadores de los alrededores de la zona, satisfaciendo la demanda de clientes que compran comida ya elaborada, así mismo por las noches vende fritanga y los fines de semana sopas. La comidería de la señora le ha sido muy rentable, ha captado un buen número de clientes que degustan de la rica, variada y económica comida que ofrece a sus clientes. Fruto de su negocio es como ha sacado adelante a su familia. Actualmente los productos que utiliza la señora en la elaboración de los platillos han aumentado su costo y se le ha dificultado adquirirlos, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar los granos básicos, la carne y las verduras que a diario necesita para la debida elaboración de los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, chicken, fish, beef, and vegetables

loans.name: Bertha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertha Elizabeth J. S. is 28 years old. She studied in high school until her third year. She has two sons that depend on her. She lives in the settlement of Victor Raul, in the district of El Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the department La Liberated.

Her business is in the sale of clothes and beauty products. She gets orders from friends and acquaintances that live in her neighborhood and also from people in the city of Trujillo. She has tried to get enough money so that she could buy a plane ticket to get to the city of Lima so she can buy products in bulk there and bring back clothes that are in the fashion.

She started her business with very little capital. Now with the loans that she has received from the Manuela Ramos Movement she can rely on having more money to invest in her business and she can be an independent woman with her own business.

The first loan that she received from the communal bank “Mujeres del Milenium” (Women on the Milenium) was for 300 Soles. With this money she was able to buy the clothing that her costumers had asked for and sell it to them.

With the loan of 1000 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will travel to the city of Lima to buy a dozen polo shirts, undergarments, skirts and blouses.

Bertha dreams of being the owner of a clothing stand in the central market in the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Bertha Elizabeth J. S. tiene 28 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el asentamiento humano Víctor Raúl en el distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad.

Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa y productos de belleza. Tiene pedidos por parte de amistades y conocidos que viven por su zona y también por la ciudad de Trujillo. Trata de reunir el mayor monto posible de dinero para viajar a la ciudad de Lima para comprar al por mayor y traer novedades en ropa. Cuando se inició en su negocio tenía muy poco capital, ahora con los prestamos que ha recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos puede contar con un mayor capital y ser una mujer independiente con su propio negocio.

El primer préstamo que recibió en su banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium” fue de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro pedidos de ropa que le habían solicitado sus clientes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en 4 meses, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprar una docena de polos de hombre, ropa interior, faldas y blusas.

La señora Bertha sueña con ser propietaria de un stand en una galería del centro de la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: polo shirts, skirts, blouses

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
The live of an artesan is one reserved mostly to creative people like Rolando, who has been making admirable and fascinating products for 38 years. With his family's help the work is more pleasant and agreeable. Thanks to his significant other he can overcome the sadness of being far from his relatives her are in Pucallpa. Rolando moved to central jungle because of his love for his wife and now his love for his 4 children. Rolando has been a good father and husband, being tireless in his work that fills his days because he works hard for his family. He hopes to increase his income and for this reason is seeking your help in order to improve the quality and increase the quantity that he offers daily.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El ser artesano es una actividad ligada básicamente a personas creativas como Rolando quien hace 38 años se dedica a la elaboración de sus admirables y fascinantes artículos y junto a su familia el trabajo es más placentero y agradable; .gracias a su pareja Rolando pudo superar la pena de estar lejos de sus familiares los cuales se encuentran en Pucallpa y el motivo por el cual Rolando se vino a radicar a la selva central fue por el gran amor de su esposa y ahora por el amor a sus 4 hijos.Rolando ha sabido ser buen padre y esposo, incansable frente a las labores que le llenan el día, siendo su familia por quienes se esfuerza. Su deseo es mejorar su ingreso y por esa razón recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de mejorar la calidad y cantidad de los productos que ofrece a diario.

loans.use: Increase capital to improve the quality and increase the quantity of her products

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is a single mother, but a very good mother, given that her children have all received the best possible upbringing. A reflection of that is the fact that today, her children are all people that actively contribute to the development of their society. Today María lives alone and is dedicated to work in handmade crafts. Every morning she can be found making her precious necklaces and bags made from typical natural resources from the jungle. However, her labor is currently in danger because the prices of the materials and instruments she needs have increased tremendously. With the goal of reforming and acquiring a larger quantity of raw materials, she turns to you, seeking your help.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

María, es madre soltera pero una muy buena madre puesto que sus hijos han tenido y recibido la mejor educación posible reflejo de este hecho es que hoy son personas que contribuyen con el desarrollo de su sociedad activamente.Hoy María vive sola y se dedica a las labores artesanalas, todas las mañanas podemos encontrarla elaborando sus preciosos collares y carteras con insumos típicos y naturales de la selva.Pero su labor puede estar en peligro porque que los materiales e instrumentos de trabajo han incrementado sus precios enormemente y con el objetivo de renovar y adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of tools and raw materials.

loans.name: Maritza Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza, together with her husband, decided to start a family business, with which they could cover all the household expenses and get their children ahead, as well as improving the family's quality of life. In the Villa Reconciliación, where the family lives, the started a small general store where they small amounts of basic goods. With years and with wise administration, the business grew, expanding the lines of products that they offer to their customers. Today it has a broad selection of many goods, among which are a variety of foodstuffs of many styles and brands - all this with the goal of bringing the people products that satisfy each of their tastes and demands. The business is the only source of income of this family, and it has allowed them to get their three children ahead and improve the structure of the house. At this time, this woman needs to supply the store with food that families consume every day, since the demand for these goods is very high.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maritza junto a su esposo decide iniciar un negocio familiar, con el cual puedan subsanar todos los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos así como el de mejorar el nivel de vida en el que se encontraban esta familia. En el barrio Villa Reconciliación, donde habita esta familia inician su negocio con una pulpería, la cual ofrecían en pequeñas cantidades productos de consumo básico, es con los años y la buena administración que el negocio logro crecer, expandiendo sus líneas de productos que ofrecían a sus clientes. Hoy en día es una Miscelánea amplia, la cual ofertan una variedad de productos alimenticios, de todas las marcas y presentaciones, todo esto con el objetivo de brindarles a la población un producto que satisfaga los gustos y exigencias de cada uno de los clientes. El negocio es la única fuente de ingreso de esta familia, el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos y mejorar la infraestructura de la casa. La señora requiere en estos momentos de abastecer el negocio de alimentos que diariamente consumen las familias, ya que la demanda de clientes en cuanto a los productos que ofrece es alta.

loans.use: Purchase stock for their general store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena R. R. is 45 years old. Because she was only able to attend school for one year, she has difficulty reading and writing. She has 5 children, but only 2 are still dependent on her. She lives in an area called Gran Chimu, in the El Porvenir district.

Elena is a native of the district of Huamachuco. From the age of 19, she began to work to earn money on her own, working as a housekeeper for several years. She began her business selling fruits and a few vegetables from a table outside of her house. Little by little and with a great amount of effort, she began buying more grocery items to sell, and eventually set up a small shop. Today she sells a variety of products including sodas and sweets.

She is associated with the communal bank called Mujeres del Milenium, from whom she received her first loan to purchase milk, noodles and oil. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, noodles and condiments.

La señora Elena R. R. tiene 45 años de edad, solo estudio un año, lee y escribe con dificultad. Tiene 5 hijos en total pero solo 2 aun dependen de ella. Vive en Gran Chimu en el distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Ella es natural del distrito de Huamachuco provincia de Sánchez Carrión departamento La Libertad, desde la edad de 19 años empezó a ganar dinero de manera dependiente ya que trabajaba en una casa como empleada, por varios años brindo sus servicios. Posteriormente se vino a radicar a la ciudad de Trujillo, consiguió un terreno en donde actualmente es su casa. Su negocio se inicia vendiendo frutas y un poco de verduras en una mesa fuera de su casa, poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo fue comprando abarrotes tenia la idea de acondicionar una pequeña bodega, así lo hizo. Actualmente cuenta con una variedad de productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas y golosinas. Ella integra el banco comunal Mujeres del Milenium, lugar donde recibió un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con ese dinero compro media docena de leche, fideo y aceite. Con el préstamo de S/. 2200.00 que pagará en 4 meses comprará 3 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 2 latas de aceite, 1 caja de leche, 5 paquetes de fideos y condimentos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

La señora Elena sueña con tener mayor capital para implementar su bodega y para vender útiles escolares para de esa manera aprovechar

loans.use: TO PURCHASE VARIOUS GROCERY ITEMS TO STOCK HER SMALL STORE.

loans.name: Pola Dionisia's Group

texts.en:
Pola, Lourdes and Carmen have been members of the community bank “Lila” for close to one year. They joined for the support and trust they found in the bank. Since joining they have learned about responsibility, punctuality, and solidarity.

Pola is 43 years old and weaves textiles. She has been weaving since she was in high school. Pola works with her sister and a friend recommended that they join the community bank.

Lourdes is 27 years old and lives with her partner and two children. Lourdes sells cellular phones as well as rents phones for individual phone calls. She started her business four months ago and is grateful to the community bank for teaching her how to make it prosper.

Carmen is 20 years old and works with her mom who owns a business selling children’s clothing. Her father encouraged them both to join the community bank.

Pola, Lourdes and Carmen need loans of 400, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy wool, cell phones, and clothing.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is that each associate has an interest earning savings account. Pola, Lourdes and Carmen plan to use their savings for emergencies, and to help their businesses grow. Their dreams are to buy land, build a home, have economic stability, work in the area of social work or be a chef, and to increase their businesses.

loans.use: To buy wool, cell phones, and clothing.

loans.name: Delfa

texts.es:
Delfa is the mother of 4 children and has been able to provide security and well being for them by means of her handmade crafts. Her husband is dedicated to the production of handmade goods and together they desire to increase the variety of their goods. In order to do so they are asking for your help by means of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Delfa es madre de cuatro hijos y con su labor artesanal ha podido brindarles seguridad y bienestar. En compañía de su esposo se dedica ala fabricación de artículos artesanales y el deseo de incrementar sus productos, la conducen a solicitar tu ayuda a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to increase the variety of goods offered.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
The fact that she is expecting doesn’t stop Olga from attending to her work sowing the corn seed. At the moment the harvest is being selected to be transported for sales. Olga’s husband is in charge of most of the sales and labor during this period, and has doubled his efforts in order to prepare for the coming arrival of the new member of their family. Every day Olga has less strength due to the weight of the baby and she is now only able to do a minimal amount of work. Nonetheless, she always has the strength to go out and move forward, given that she hopes to offer everything possible to her little one. Olga is asking for a loan in order for the conservation of her land, and to cultivate and increase the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

OLGA a pesar de estar en la dulce espera no deja de trabajar en sus sembríos de maíz, al momento de la cosecha los selecciona para que después sean transportados para su venta y de esta labor se encarga su querido esposo, quien ha doblado los esfuerzos por la pronta llegada de el nuevo miembro de familia.A pesar del esfuerzo que realizan Olga cada vez tiene menos fuerzas por el peso de su bebé y el trabajo que ahora realiza es mínimo pero lo rescatable de esta madre es que a pesar de su estado siempre tiene fuerzas para salir adelante y ahora más que nunca porque desea ofrecer todo lo necesario a su pequeño.Por ello Olga nos hace una petición de un préstamo para mejor conservación de sus campos de cultivo e incrementar de la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa is a seamstress and sews various types of polo shirts and dresses that her neighbors and friends request from her. She has a large quantity of beautiful fabrics in her sewing workshop that she recently opened. She worked in a sewing shop before but she wanted to become more independent and thought it better to open her own business in order to feel truly content. She is single and her desire for advancement is based on her hope to offer her future family economic stability. In order to reach that goal she is already working arduously towards realizing her dream. Without a doubt, it all has a price. Stability is not created overnight. Teresa is well aware of this, and is now in need of capital in order to buy a greater quantity of fabrics in the capital where it would easier to get them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

DOÑA Teresa es costurera y confecciona diversos tipos de polos y vestidos que le solicitan sus vecinos y amigos y tiene una gran cantidad de hermosas telas dentro de su taller de costura que abrió recientemente. Trabajaba en una taller de costura pero quiso independizarse y que mejor que abrir su propio negocio en la cual se siente verdaderamente contenta, es soltera y sus ganas de superación están basadas en ofrecer a su futura familia estabilidad económica y para alcanzar este propósito ya está trabajando arduamente con la esperanza de realizar sus anhelos.Sin duda todo tiene un precio y el forjarse estabilidad económica no se realiza de la noche a la mañana y esto lo sabe muy bien Teresa, a quien le urge un capital para comprar diversas telas de la capital en la que los podría obtener muy cómodo.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of fabrics.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes works as a supervisor in a school and during the afternoons she supervises her own restaurant that is hires young people that she trusts. They work with the public all day and also sell cosmetics to a large customer base as well as to their friends. Because her primary source of income is this small restaurant, she would like to expand it and install a showcase from which she can show her delicious plates she prepares daily .

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

LOURDES, trabaja como docente en una institución educativa y por las tardes se dedica a la supervisión de su restaurante que es atendido por jóvenes de su entera confianza. Ellos se dedican a la atención al público durante todo el día, adicionalmente se dedica a ofertar cosméticos a la gran cantidad de clientes y amigos.Debido a que la principal fuente de su economía es su pequeño restaurante ha planeado ampliarlo y adecuar los espacios para instalar estantes de exhibición de los deliciosos platos que se preparan a diario en este lugar.

loans.use: The expansion of her small store area in order to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.name: Erminia

texts.es:
Eminia A. is 47 years old and was only able to study until the third grade. She has one son who is dependent on her. She lives in the district of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province in La Libertad. She has a business selling different kinds of processed meats and cheeses such as sausages, hot dogs and mortadela, which she buys wholesale from different distributors and sells. She has requests from friends and people she knows who work in the local shoe shops. So, in her free time, she also makes shoe boxes and sells them by the dozen, generating additional income for her home.

She used to prepare and sell lunches and distribute them to the shops as well, but she had to stop that work as it was too tiring. She and a friend had an idea to sell cheese and cheese products at the wholesale fair and it has gone very well, little by little growing their business thanks to the loan from the communal bank, Mujeres del Milenium, which they used to buy cooking ingredients. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy more meat and cheese products as well as honey.

La señora Eminia V. A. tiene 47 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Su negocio es la venta de todo tipo de embutidos como: mortadela, hog dog, salchicha y quesos el cual compra al por mayor a los respectivos distribuidores, tiene pedidos por los talleres de zapatería de amistades y conocidos. Además en sus ratos libres elabora caja de zapatos en un taller de zapatería el cual le pagan por docena, de esa manera ella tiene otro ingreso en su hogar. Anteriormente vendía almuerzos y repartía también por los talleres, pero abandono ese negocio por motivo que era muy sacrificado y cansado. Con una amiga tuvo la idea de vender queso y quesillo en la feria del mayorista y le iba muy bien poco a poco ha ido incrementando su mercadería gracias a los prestamos que recibió en su banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium”, el primero fue de S/. 300.00 con el que compro taperes y los ingredientes para cocinar. Con el ultimo préstamo de S/.1500.00 el cual pagara en 4 meses comprara embutidos: 10 conos de mortadela, 60 kilogramos de quesillo que le envían desde Mache, 2 docenas de queso mantecoso y miel de abeja. La señora Erminia sueña con implementar y acondicionar una tienda de accesorios para carros en un local.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE TO HELP GROW HER BUSINESS SELLING MEAT AND CHEESE PRODUCTS AT THE WHOLESALE MARKETS.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Louisa, and Ysabel have been members of the community bank “Lila” for six, eleven, and five years respectively. They appreciate the support the community bank gives them. Since joining they have learned business management skills, punctuality, and savings. In addition, they have learned about self-esteem and personal responsibility.

Maria is 36 years old, and is a single mother raising five children who are between the ages of twenty and six. Maria sells firewood as well as fruit. To get the fruit she travels eight hours by poor roads to the jungle region. She has been running this business for four years.

Louisa is 55 years old, is married, and has six children who are 38, 36, 34, 32, 30, and 28. Louisa sells food at the local market, and she has been selling there for over thirty years.

Ysabel is 49 years old, is a widow, and has seven children, three of whom still live with her. Ysabel makes and sells a typical bread called “chapla” which is similar to pita bread. She sells her bread from a regional bus stop. Ysabel has had this business for twenty-eight years.

Maria, Louisa, and Ysabel need loans of 1600, 800, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying things such as wood, plates, napkins, and flour.

Maria, Louisa, and Ysabel dream of being able to buy a car, see their children get an education, and have a better life.

loans.use: To buy wood, plates, napkins, and flour.

loans.name: Mayer

texts.es:
Mayer always had an inkling for creating and ever since he was a child, he has been making his own shirts besides sportive wear as well, and now that he has become a father he has the obligation to care for his family's well being, and there is nothing better than to work in a field you enjoy. Nevertheless, he had a motorcycle accident while transporting some shirts he was going to sell; he was going down the street without any problems when all of a sudden a car appeared and blocked his passage, throwing Mayer to the ground, when he woke up he was in the hospital, where he had been taken promptly after the accident. Despite his accident, Mayer continues to work in his tailor shop, but now he is confronted with the expenses of his hospital stay and the repair of his motorcycle, and he would like to ask us for our help so that he can alleviate some of his worries and get back his normal rhythm of life and health.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mayer siempre tuvo el don de la confección y desde niño deseaba hacerse sus propias camisetas y además implementos deportivos, ahora que se ha convertido en padre de familia y tiene la obligación de velar por su bienestar, que mejor que trabajar en lo que más le agrada. Sin embargo tuvo un fatídico accidente cuando estuvo transportando con su moto los pedidos de camisetas por entregar; transitaban sin problemas de pronto un carro se le presentó y le cerró el pase dejando en el suelo a don Mayer quien al recuperarse y volver en sí se halló en el hospital al que fue evacuado rápidamente..Pese a su accidente hallamos a Mayer en su taller de costura con algunas heridas y golpes debido al accidente pero con una gran fortaleza e inmensos deseos de continuar pese a la circunstancias, ahora tiene que hacerle frente a los gastos de su accidente y la reparación de su moto y desea podamos ayudarlo a reducir su preocupación y restablecer nuevamente su ritmo de trabajo y salud.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle and to purchase more products.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes has sold fruit for many years, however, now thanks to her storefront she can practice her traD. more regularly and offer a higher quantity of products to her customers. She works with her husband in the store and he is the one who searches for their products and handles the purchasing. Despite this constant fruit business in Santa Ana, they have noticed that their children are growing up without many of life's necessities. And so, Lourdes is asking for a loan so that we can help to see her business grow and consolidate in a sustainable business.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Lourdes, desD. hace varios años se dedica al negocio D. venta D. frutas; pero ahora gracias a su bodega pueD. realizar D. manera más continua y en mayor cantidad L. oferta D. estos productos, ésta actividad L. realiza con su esposo y es precisamente él quien realiza L. búsqueda y descarga. A pesar D. que el negocio D. fruta en Santa Ana es constante sin embargo ha observado que a medida que sus hijos van creciendo el incremento D. sus necesidades también se ha hecho más notoria.Y frente e esta panorama Lourdes piD. le podamos ayudar a acrecentar su negocio para consolidarlo y hacer sostenible su negocio D. frutas.

loans.use: Increase revenue to add more stability to her occupation.

loans.name: Flor Consuelo

texts.es:
Flor Consuelo is 73 years old and has five children, none of whom are still dependent on her. She was only able to attend school until the 5th graD.. From the time she was independent, she looked for ways to work or have her own business. But when she married, her husband earned a sufficient salary to cover their household expenses.

Ten years ago, when her husband died, she realized she needed to go back to work. She began by selling stuffed potatoes and tamales to her friends and neighbors. She traveled often to her home town, where her friends were requesting many items they could not find in that zone. She began expanding the merchandise she offered.

She is part of the communal bank called Mujeres del Milenium, from whom she received her first loan for her business. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy more stock such as tablecloths and sheets, charcoal and wool, as well as school supplies because the school term is beginning.

La señora Flor Consuelo Y. D. T. tiene 73 años D. edad, sólo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado D. primaria. Tiene cinco hijos pero ninguno depenD. D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Trujillo en la provincia D. la misma en el departamento La Libertad. DesD. que se independizó siempre ha buscado la manera D. trabajar en algo o tener su propio negocio, pero cuando se casó dejo D. hacerlo ya que su esposo era jefe D. campamento y recibía un sueldo muy aceptable con el cual cubría todas sus necesidades. Hace 10 años que él falleció y ella se vio en la necesidad D. volver a trabajar empezó vendiendo papa rellena y tamales el cual ofrecía a sus vecinos y conocidos, constantemente viajaba a su ciudad natal; amigos y mucha gente que conocía le hacían pedidos D. acuerdo a las necesidades que existe hasta ahora en la zona; frazadas, chompas abarrotes y otros. Así también venD. briquetas y leña (materiales que sirve para cocinar los alimentos). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium” lugar donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro panteones, por ese tiempo se acercaban las fiestas naviD.ñas. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 que lo pagara en 4 meses comprará media docena D. frazadas, una docena D. mantas y sabanas, 1 millar D. briquetas y 600 rajas D. leña. Además comprara útiles escolares ya que se aproxima la época colegial. La señora Flor sueña con comprar una moto para que lo trabaja su hijo en la sierra ya que es D. mucha necesidad para los pobladores D. la zona

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: SINCE HER HUSBAND DIED 10 YEARS AGO,  FLOR CONSUELO NEEDED TO GO BACK TO WORK AT THE AGE OF 73.  SHE WILL USE THE LOAN TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma prepares her delicious kebabs to sell in the plaza Santa Ana, where she sets up shop every afternoon until the wee hours of the night. She has always been dedicated to this form of business and has decided to increase production during the school vacations of the children in high school. Because her main customers go back to school soon, she would like to ask for a loan to invest in purchasing more products to be able to sell in the upcoming week.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Vilma todas las tardes prepara sus deliciosos anticuhos para ofertarlos en la plaza de Santa Ana en el que se instala cada tarde hasta altas horas de la noche. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de algunos comestibles y ha decidido ocupar la época de vacaciones de los niños en el colegio con esta actividad.Debido a que sus clientes están próximos a retornar a su aulas de estudios desea obtener un préstamo de dinero a fin de invertirlos en la compra de los productos que ofertará dentro de una semana.

loans.use: Injection of capital to acquire sweets, cookies, and soft drinks to sell in her small business.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, a young artisan, who earns his living fabricating creative and beautiful decorations which he sells in his small store, which is also his home because it is situated on a beautiful beach in the city and he gets to work along side people he loves, who are his first priority in life. Despite having quite a talent, he is in a difficult financial situation at the moment because the distribution of his products is very costly in his city and would like to travel to a place where he knows he can purchase materials cheaper and therefore reduce the selling cost of his merchandise. With your help, this exemplary father will be able to achieve his goal.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Marcos, es un joven artesano que para ganarse la vida realiza creativos y hermosos adornos artesanales que oferta en su pequeño local que también le sirve de vivienda debido a que está situado en una hermosa playa de la ciudad de la merced, trabaja a lado de sus seres queridos quienes se han convertido en su prioridad.A pesar de tener mucha habilidad tiene el inconveniente económico ya que la distribución de las cosas que utiliza para su trabajo es muy costosa en su ciudad y ha planeado viajar al lugar donde la extraen para abaratar los costos de sus artículos.Con tu ayuda este ejemplar padre podrá alcanzar su propósito.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase production.

loans.name: Jesus Angelita

texts.es:
Jesus Angelita is 33 years old and has two children who depend on her. She was only able to study up until 6th grade. She lives in a place called Nueva Rinconada, in the Trujillo province of La Libertad. During the summer time, she sells raspadillas, a local shaved ice snack, from a busy corner where many people walk by. She has had this business since she was 15 years old. She also sells sodas and snacks from a three wheel bicycle, as well as beers from her home as it's difficult to find beer in the zone where she lives. In the afternoons, she prepares stuffed potatoes to sell outside of her home.

Angelita is a member of the communal bank called Mujeres Decididas, from whom she received her first loan for her business to purchase beer. With this new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase beer, sodas, ice and ingredients for the raspadillas she sells. Her goal is to be able to set up a shop inside of her home.

La señora Jesús Angelita V. C. tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en un lugar llamado “Nueva Rinconada” en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Por temporada de verano vende raspadillas (nombre con el cual se conoce al hielo molido con jarabes dulces) en una esquina muy transitada por varios peatones, desde que tenia 15 años se dedica a este negocio, además en un triciclo vende sandías y gaseosas. Así también los fines de semana vende cerveza en su casa, ya que por la zona donde vive es difícil encontrar esta bebida. Por las tardes prepara papa rellena y sale a vender fuera de su casa. La señora Angelita es socia fundadora del banco comunal “Mujeres Decididas” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió todo en comprar cerveza. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses comprara 25 cajas de cerveza, 2 cajas de gaseosas, 1 bloque de hielo y jarabes dulces. Su mayor anhelo es acondicionar una tienda en su domicilio

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ITEMS SHE NEEDS FOR HER BUSINESS TO GROW, SUCH AS SODAS, BEER, ICE AND SWEETS

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy is the father of three daughters, whom he adores. To support them, he works as an artisan, which isn't terrible for him either since he enjoys his work and has an enthusiasm for it because of the capacity for creativity required in his job. However, his enjoyable work, which is also his primary source of income, may see itself hit a hard patch because of the difficulty in attaining some prime ingredients and other production materials. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can acquire these materials and continue making his creative artesian crafts and not have to slow down his labor because of the lack of materials. Percy hopes that your noble heart will help him to continue in his life as an artisan.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Percy, es padre de tres hijas que son su adoración; por ellas se dedica a la artesanía actividad que no le es difícil debido a que le gusta mucho y se desenvuelve con entusiasmo por la enorme capacidad de creatividad que se necesita para sus diversos trabajos manuales, sin embargo su agradable labor y principal fuente de ingreso puede verse interrumpida por su difícil acceso a las diversas semillas y materiales de producción.Es por ello que solicita a usted un préstamo para adquirir sus materiales y seguir elaborando sus creativos productos artesanales y así no interrumpir su actividad económica .Percy espera que su noble corazón lo pueda ayudar a seguir su vida como artesano.

loans.use: Injection of capital for more investments

loans.name: Franci

texts.es:
Franci works cultivating banana plantations. This activity helps to support his family. He is dedicated 100% to his cultivation of banana plantations that he acquired with a lot of effort and sacrifice. His lands under cultivation require a lot of care and clearing to favor the development and growth of his fruit trees. Due to this he needs supplements and fertilizer and also tools for the clearing of his lands. With your aid he will be able to compile the amount that he requests to acquire what he needs so much.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Franci es dedica al cultivo de platanales, esta actividad le ayuda al sostén de su familia. Él está dedicado al 100% a sus cultivos de platanales que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio y cuyos terrenos de cultivo requieren de muchos cuidados y limpieza que propicien un desarrollo y crecimiento de sus frutales y debido a ello necesita de abonos y fertilizantes y también herramientas para la limpieza de sus terrenos.Con vuestra ayuda podrá recopilar la cantidad que solicita para adquirir lo que tanta falta le hace.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, fertilizer and tools.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria has two children, for whom she diligently works for with strength and vigor in her agriculture business. She tends to her farming land with the objective of quickly detecting even the most minor problem and eliminating it. To do this she needs several fertilizers, and for this reason she turns to you in search of your help with the goal of acquiring these necessary agricultural supplies for the normal and optimal cultivation of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

MARÍA, tiene dos hijos, por quienes se desempeña con fortaleza y vigor en su actividad agrícola, cuida sus terrenos de cultivo a fin de detectar el menor problema rápido y eliminarlo; para esta actividad necesita de abonos y fertilizantes y por esa razón recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de adquirir estos insumos necesarios para el normal y buen crecimiento de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers.

loans.name: Bernicia

texts.es:
Thanks to her mother, Bernicia was able to know the great benefits of medicinal plants, which not only helped her but also allowed her to transform this into a fountain of revenue for her home. Thanks to her great knowledge visits to her shop have increased and her desire is to further implement things in this space in order to offer a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernicia, gracias a su madre pudo conocer los grandes beneficios de las plantas medicinales y ahora no sólo la ayuda sino también se han convertido en una fuente de ingresos para su hogar, debido a su gran conocimiento las visitas a su espacio de ventas se han incrementado y su deseo es implementar este espacio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, también piensa iniciar a vender artículos artesanales y ha iniciado fabricando unos pequeños adornos.

loans.use: implement her shop in order to provide comfort for her customers

loans.name: Mery Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mery Elizabeth is 42 years old and studied to work in a clinic. She was not able to pursue her career because there were not many jobs available, and also because she got married and had children. She has 3 children who depend on her. They live in the Trujillo district, in La Libertad.

She began selling beauty products, having previously worked as a teacher. With the money she earned she bought a small cart and began to sell prepared meals from in front of her house. She stopped this business because she wasn't earning enough money. She eventually took a class near her home where she learned how to sew various pieces such as furniture covers and tapestries. She also began to buy small appliances from wholesalers which she sold at a better price.

She is part of the communal bank called Mujeres del Milenium, from whom she received her first loan to help her business. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase school supplies to sell, taking advantage of the beginning of the school season, as well as travel to Huamachuco to sell her appliances.

Her dream is to one day have a store in the center of Trujillo where she can sell all kinds of appliances.

La señora tiene 42 años de edad, estudio la carrera técnica de laboratorio clínico, no ejerció su carrera por motivo que por ese tiempo no había mucha demanda de trabajo para su especialidad y también porque estaba comprometida con el que actualmente es padre de sus hijos. Tiene tres hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Trujillo provincia de la misma, en el departamento La Libertad. Ella se inicia vendiendo productos de belleza, posteriormente trabajó como profesora en el magisterio del distrito de Virú, con el dinero que ganó compro su carrito sanguchero el cual hacia algunos preparados y vendía fuera de su casa, pero cerró porque no le era muy rentable. Estudio un curso de manualidades cerca de su domicilio en el que aprendio a realizar diversos trabajos como: coronas de tela que se utilizan para los difuntos además en una maquina de cocer elabora forro para muebles y edredones, teje tapetes y fundas. Así también compra artefactos al por mayor el cual lo vuelve a vender a mayor precio, algunos de éstos los envía a la sierra liberteña especialmente a Humachuco. Ella integra el banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium” en el que le dieron su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró útiles escolares para vender a sus amistades y conocidos que le hacían pedidos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses comprara útiles escolares ya que aprovechara la campaña escolar, viajará a Huamachuco a ofrecer estos productos además de artefactos como microondas y una olla arrocera. La señora Mery es presidenta del vaso de leche “Zoila Victoria de la Torre de la Haya” ubicado en su distrito. Ella sueña con acondicionar un local en el centro de la ciudad de Trujillo en el que venda todo tipo de artefactos.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SCHOOL SUPPLIES WHICH SHE WILL SELL, AS THE SCHOOL TERM IS BEGINNING, AS WELL AS SMALL APPLIANCES SHE PURCHASES WHOLESALE TO LATER SELL AT A BETTER PRICE.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Lourdes, a native of the city of Jualica, is a very happy mother and worker with four sons. Since a very young age she dedicated herself to the making gloves, scarves and other wool products. She learned this beautiful art thanks to the teachings of her dear loving mother who taught her. After beginning her family Maria Lourdes, with much insistence, begin to develop this beautiful work, where she puts her creativity in each of her wool clothing pieces. She offers them in the Sunday market in the city of Juliaca, in the same place where her husband dedicates himself to selling construction bricks. This couple's dream is to repair their home and in this way offer comfort and safety for their sons. To reach this she is appealing to your good heart and is soliciting a loan. "Your good heart will allow for the accomplishments of the dreams of this family."

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Lourdes, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca es madre muy alegre y trabajadora de 4 hijos, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a la confección de chompas, guantes, chullos y chalinas, ella aprendió este bello arte de tejer gracias a las enseñanzas de su querida madre quien con sumo amor inculcó sus conocimientos en ella.Una vez que formó su familia Maria Lourdes, con mucho más empeño se siguió desenvolviendo en su bello trabajo, luego de poner su creatividad en cada uno de sus prendas de vestir los oferta en el mercado Dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, en tanto su esposo se dedica a la venta de ladrillos de construcción. El deseo de esta pareja es hacer refaccionar su domicilio y así ofrecerles comodidad y seguridad a sus hijos, con ese fin recurren a tu buen corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo.“Tu buen corazón permitirá cumplir los deseos de esta familia”

loans.use: Repair their home

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya is a very happy and responsible girl, her parents always dedicated themselves to the buying and selling of red meat in the Túpac Amaru market in the city of Juliaca. Since she was very young Cinthya supported her parents in this business, learning to manage very well and with her happiness and good attention she obtained very good clients. For this reasons she decided to become independent and open her own business of buying and selling meat, always with the unconditional support of her parents. Currently this enterprising girl covers all of her personal expenses and higher education fees with this business. She begins her days at 7 am, studying very enthusiastically in order to better herself. Beginning at noon she goes to the market where she attends to her sales of meat. Thanks to her insistence and diligence she is able to obtain good results. In order to generate greater economic gains she thinks that she must augment her capital, for this proposition she is appealing to your good heart and soliciting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Cinthya, es una muchacha muy alegre y responsable, sus padres siempre se dedicaron a la compra y venta de carnes rojas en el mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca, Cinthya desde muy pequeña apoyó a sus padres en dicho negocio, aprendiendo a desenvolverse muy bien y así con su alegría y buena atención fue obteniendo muy buenos clientes, es por ello que decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio de compra y venta de carne, siempre con apoyo incondicional de sus padres.Actualmente ésta emprendedora muchacha cubre todos sus gastos personales y de estudios superiores con este negocio, ella durante todos los días desde las 7:00 de la mañana inicia su día cotidiano, acudiendo a estudiar muy entusiasta para buscar su superación personal, a partir del medio día se dirige al mercado donde atiende su puesto de venta de carnes.Gracias a su empeño y su diligencia está logrando obtener buenos resultados, para generar mayores ingresos económicos tiene pensado aumentar el monto de su capital, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: increasing capital in order to increase the amount of products she offers

loans.name: Cesarea's Group

texts.en:
Cesarea and Basilia are members of the community bank “Lila”. Cesarea has been a member for almost three years while Basilia joined four months ago. In that time they have learned punctuality, and how to work efficiently. They say that they enjoy meetings and look forward to them every week.

Cesarea is 41 years old, is married, and has eight children, five of whom still live with her. She sells grains, and has been working in this area for seven years.

Basilia is 45 years old, is married, and has five children. In the past she also sold grains, but three years ago she made the decision to begin selling vegetables.

Cesarea and Basilia need loans of 800 and 600 soles (3 soles - $1), which they will invest in buying things such as wheat, corn, barley, rice, squash, carrots, and other vegetables.

Their dream is to have a good life and enjoy themselves.

loans.use: To buy wheat, corn, barley, rice, squash, carrots, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo is a vigorous and enterprising father of 29 years of age, was married four years ago with Daríia, and out of the fruits of their union was born the little Jerry, who currently is three years old. During many of these years this exemplary man was working as a chauffeur for a transportation company, while his sweet wife dedicated herself to the sale of candy. Despite straining themselves and dedicated themselves integrally to their work they were unable to obtain good economic gains. For this reason, they decided to work together and being a business buying and selling american clothing. Aldo and charming wife acquired their bundles of merchandise in la Paz (Bolivia) and they sell it in their native city of Juliaca y Puno. Noticing that this business was profitable they decided to acquire a space where they can exhibit the immense variety of bundles they possess. Currently, with much insistence, diligence and compromise they just inaugurated this office. This couple's wish is to obtain a loan that they plan to invest in their shop and they are certain that with your help they will be able to realize their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Aldo, es un vigoroso y emprendedor padre de 29 años de edad, hace 4 años contrajo matrimonio con Daría fruto de su unión nació su pequeño niño Jerry, quien actualmente ya tiene 3 años de edad, durante muchos años este ejemplar hombre estuvo trabajando como chofer en una empresa de transportes, en tanto su dulce esposa se dedicaba a la venta de golosinas al por mayor, por más que se esforzaban y se dedicaban íntegramente a sus trabajos no lograban obtener buenos ingresos económicos, es por esa razón que decidieron trabajar juntos e incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de ropas americanas, Aldo y su encantadora esposa adquieren su mercadería por fardos en la Paz (Bolivia) y los venden en su ciudad natal Juliaca y Puno, al ver que este negocio les esta resultando rentable decidieron alquilar un local y exhibir la inmensa variedad de prendas que poseen en ella, actualmente con mucho empeño, diligencia y compromiso vienen desenvolviéndose en este oficio.El deseo de esta pareja es obtener un préstamo debido a que tienen pensado invertir esta cantidad dinero en su negocio y están seguros que con tu ayuda podrán concretar sus deseos.

loans.use: Increase of capital in order to offer a larger quantity of clothing

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Her gift of persuasion and ability in sales are what has made doña Consuelo successful in her business selling beauty supplies and natural products. She got her start in this business two years ago thanks to the invitation of a friend when she was experiencing a very difficult time economically. Consuelo offers her merchandise to family members, neighbors, friends and travels through her town for several hours a day trying to obtain as many orders as possible. With her earnings she has been able to cover her family’s expenditures and, above all, education for her 10 year old daughter Roxana. Consuelo is the only one who looks out for their security and well-being since Roxana’s father abandoned them. Consuelo is very happy about what she has achieved. She has many plans and work-related projects. The only problem is that she does not have enough working capital to turn her dreams into reality. For this reason, she appeals to your good heart and intentions and requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Su don de persuasión y agilidad de venta son los que llevan a doña Consuelo a tener éxito en sus negocios de venta de productos de belleza y productos naturales Tiens, incursionó en este negocio hace 2 años gracias a la invitación que su amiga le hizo cuando pasaba por momentos económicos muy críticos.Consuelo ofrece su mercadería a sus familiares, vecinos, amigos y recorre durante horas su ciudad con el fin de obtener mayor cantidad de pedidos posibles, y con las ganancias que obtiene ha cubre sus gastos familiares y sobre todo la educación de su pequeña niña Roxana de 10 años de edad, puesto que es la única persona que vela por la seguridad y el bienestar de su hogar desde que el padre de su niña las abandonó.Ella se siente muy contenta con lo que está logrando, tiene muchos planes y proyectos con su negocio, pero tiene un problema, no cuenta con suficiente capital para hacer realidad sus deseos, es por ese motivo que apela a tu buen corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in working capital to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Rosa Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is 41 years old and studied up until 5th grade in school. She has 4 children but only 2 still depend on her. They live in the Trujillo district of La Libertad. For the last 8 years she has worked selling clothing for women, men and children. She began with very little demand, sometimes only a few requests from her neighbors. Today she has a greater variety of garments to offer, and she travels around various areas of the city to sell to her clients.

Bertha is part of the communal bank called Mujeres Decididas, from whom she received her first loan to travel to Lima to purchase clothing. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase womans and mens shirts, as well as seasonal garments for summer such as shorts. Bertha dreams of one day renting a stand in a shopping area in the city of Trujillo.

La señora Bertha tiene 41 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene cuatro hijos pero solo dos dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Trujillo provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Hace ocho años que se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, empezó con poca mercadería, a veces sólo con pedidos que le hacían algunos vecinos. Actualmente tiene mayor variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes, recorre en condición de ambulante por distintos lugares de la ciudad de Trujillo. Ella integra el banco comunal “Mujeres Decididas” en el cual recibió un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 monto con el que viajó a la ciudad de Lima para traer novedades en ropa. Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00 que los cancelará en 4 meses, viajara a Lima a comprar polos de damas y caballeros, así también traerá novedades por temporada de verano tales como: shorts, faldas y bermudas. La señora Bertha sueña con alquilar un stand en una galería del centro de la ciudad de Trujillo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CLOTHING WHICH SHE SELLS IN VARIOUS LOCATIONS AROUND THE CITY, AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Iva Centre -Group 1

texts.en: Iva is an agricultural village on the rural island of Savaii in SaM..  When South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) recently opened a branch in Salelologa, the capital town of Savaii, the group noticed the new office, which is very near the town market. One of them visited the office, made inquiries and scheduled a meeting with SPBD at their village. She gathered all of the requirements and started sharing the exciting news about the possibility of getting a loan to improve their farms. The members attended four weekly SPBD training sessions and are now ready to apply for loans for their farms to improve their production and increase their respective incomes.

loans.use: To buy farm implements and agricultural supplies (wheelbarrows, bush knives, sprayers, seeds, taro tubers, fertilizers and weed killers)

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is 34 years old and completed her secondary schooling. She has 2 children but only one is still dependent on her. They live in an area called Victor Raul in Trujillo, in La Libertad. She has a small stand in the mini market called Los Pinos, located in the center of Trujillo. This is a place where they sell all kinds of vegetables, condiments. In order to increase earnings, she purchases her products wholesale at the La Hermelinda market every morning,

She began her business selling small quantities of clothing, which her friends had requested. Later, she sold fish, and finally settled on her current business and feels content that it is growing each day. She is part of the communal bank called Mujeres del Milenium, from whom she received her first loan to travel to Lima to purchase clothing. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase vegetables, ground garlic and other items to sell in her business.

Rosario has a goal; She would like to be able to purchase a car so she can begin offering a transportation service.

La señora Rosario I. A. tiene 34 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos en total pero uno aun depende de ella. Vive en el asentamiento humano Víctor Raúl del distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Actualmente tiene un pequeño puesto en el minimarket “los pinos”, ubicado en el centro de Trujillo, lugar donde vende todo tipo de verduras, condimentos, menestras y tubérculos. Para tener mayor ganancia compra al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda”, todas las mañanas antes de dirigirse a su negocio hace sus respectivas compras. Su negocio se inicia vendiendo un poco de ropa el cual le hacían pedidos amigos y conocidos, posteriormente vendió pescado y por ultimo se dedico a su actual negocio, se siente contenta de prosperar cada día. Ella integra el banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium” en donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero viajo a la ciudad de Lima para comprar algunos pedidos de ropa. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará 20 kilogramos de menestras, verduras, tres docenas de ajos molidos, rocoto y ensaladas. La señora Rosario tiene una meta: Comprar un auto en el que ofrezca servicio como línea de transporte.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE VEGETABLES, GROUND GARLIC AND OTHER ITMES WHICH SHE SELLS FROM A SMALL STAND IN THE MINI MARKET OF TRUJILLO.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl is a very responsible father who has always watched out for the well-being and security of his children. A few years ago he and his wife decided to separate. For many years Raúl worked as a pre-sales agent in a private company that made carbonated beverages, but because of internal problems the business closed. Faced with a shortage of employment opportunities and the need to provide stability to his children, he decided to invest the settlement funds from his prior position in the purchase of a taxicab. With that small but indispensible mode of transportation he offers the people of Juliaqueña mobility and at the same time provides comfort and security to his children. Unfortunately, three weeks ago he had mechanical problems with his taxi and for this reason he wishes to obtain a loan in order to repair his vehicle and continue to do his job as he has up to present with total professionalism and interest in his beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Raúl, es un padre muy responsable que siempre veló por el bienestar y seguridad de sus hijos, hace algunos años en mutuo acuerdo decidió separarse de su esposa, sin desproteger a sus pequeños niños, durante muchos años atrás Raúl trabajó como preventista en una empresa privada de bebidas gaseosas, pero por problemas internos la empresa decidió cerrar, ante la carencia de oportunidades de empleo y la necesidad de brindarles tranquilidad a sus hijos decidió invertir la liquidación de su trabajo en la compra de una movilidad (taxi), con esa pequeña pero indispensable herramienta de transportes está brindando movilidad a la población Juliaqueña y al mismo tiempo les brinda comodidad y tranquilidad a sus hijos.Desafortunadamente hace 3 semanas viene teniendo problemas con su movilidad, es por esa razón que desea obtener un préstamo para reparar su automóvil a fon de continuar desempeñándose como lo venía haciendo hasta el momento con sumo profesionalismo e interés por sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Repair of his vehicle

loans.name: José

texts.es:
The need to improve his income and provide education to his three dear children are the reasons Don José is courteously requesting this loan. He is a very responsible and hardworking father who for many years was dedicated to the business of buying and selling dollars. At first this business was very successful, but competition in the market reduced the income that came from this work. In looking at the needs of his family, José decided to create a back-up source of income and started a business buying and selling American style clothes. José acquires his merchandise in La Paz (Bolivia) and sells it in the Manco Cápac market in his hometown, Juliaca, and with this job he hopes to return to worry-free times for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

La necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos económicos y brindarles educación a sus 3 menores y queridos hijos son el motivo que tiene don José para solicitarte gentilmente un préstamo. Él es un padre muy responsable y trabajador que durante muchos años estaba dedicado al negocio de compra y venta de dólares, en un inicio este negocio le fue muy rentable pero la competencia que existe en el mercado hizo que disminuyera los ingresos que percibía por este trabajo, al observar las necesidades de su familia decidió crear otro respaldo económico e incursionó en el negocio de compra y venta de ropa americana, José adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de la Paz ( Bolivia) y los vende en el mercado Manco Cápac de su ciudad natal Juliaca y con este oficio está logrando recuperar la tranquilidad de su familia.

loans.use: Increase working capital to purchase a larger quantity of clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Since he was a boy, Nicanor was always a working and responsible man. Since starting his family Nicanor has always tried to work hard so that his dear family will not face limitations and economic hardship. He is father to five children and their only source of income is his honorable job offering transportation services with his pedal-taxi. After having numerous problems, Nicanor and his wife mutually decided to separate. He feels very sad and depressed because he is not permitted to see his children and enjoy their love and company now that they live with their mother. Nevertheless, he works very hard in order to send his dear children what they need in order to have an education and the comfort they deserve. He is asking for your help in order to continue working for the well-being of his children. He is seeking a loan to use for repairs to and improvement of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Desde muchacho el señor Nicanor siempre fue un hombre trabajador y responsable, desde que formó su familia constantemente trató de esforzarse para que sus seres queridos no pasen limitaciones y privaciones económicas, él es padre de 5 hijos y su única fuente de ingreso económico es su noble oficio de brindar servicios de movilidad en su pequeña herramienta de transporte (Triciclo).Nicanor después de tener innumerables problemas con su esposa ambos en mutuo acuerdo decidieron separarse, pero se siente muy triste y abatido porque no le permiten ver y disfrutar del cariño y compañía de sus pequeños, ya que viven con su madre y ella se opone rotundamente; sin embargo Nicanor se esfuerza enormemente para enviarles lo necesario a sus queridos hijos para que éstos puedan recibir la educación y bienestar que se merecen.En esta oportunidad solicita tu ayuda para seguir esforzándose por el bienestar de sus retoños y hace la petición de un préstamo que tiene pensado invertir en la reparación y mejoramiento de su herramienta de trabajo..

loans.use: Repairs to his humble work vehicle

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana has always been a business woman and very enterprising; since adolescence she worked in clothing sales. Her daughter Cinthia was born 12 years ago while she was engaged. Unfortunately things did not go well in that relationship and after many disappointments she decided to end the relationship. At that time, with a goal of being able to offer the best to her daughter, she decided to open a little grocery store. This shop has turned out to be profitable and very useful for her neighbors as well because thanks to the variety of merchandise she can cater to and please everyone. After 10 years of dedicating herself entirely to her daughter, she decided to give herself a second opportunity and now has two children at her side, which provide her a double motive to continue making efforts in life. Susana has in mind expanding her little grocery store and increasing the amount of merchandise and clothing she has available. It is for this reason that she asks for your help and is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Susana, siempre fue una mujer de negocios y muy emprendedora, desde adolescente se dedicó a la comercialización de prendas de vestir; fruto de su primer compromiso nació Cinthia, niña de 12 años de edad, desafortunadamente las cosas en su relación no le resultaron muy bien, después de muchas desilusiones decidió separarse de su pareja, desde entonces con el fin de ofrecerle lo mejor a su hija decidió abrir una tiendita de abarrotes, esta bodeguita le fue resultando rentable y muy útil a sus vecinos porque gracias a la variedad de su mercadería puede complacer y satisfacer a todos.Luego de 10 años de haberse dedicado íntegramente a su hija decidió darse una segunda oportunidad, actualmente ya con 2 retoños a su lado tiene doble motivo para seguir esforzándose en la vida; Susana tiene pensado ampliar su bodeguita de abarrotes y aumentar la cantidad de mercadería de prendas de vestir que oferta también en un espacio de este lugar, con ese propósito solicita tu ayuda y te hace la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase her working capital to purchase a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.en:
Alejandra and Marlene are members of the community bank “Sumacc Huayta”. Alejandra has been a member for one year, while Marlene joined three years ago. They joined the community bank because there are fewer requirements and they did not need collateral. Through the bank they have learned responsibility and the importance of saving.

Alejandra is married and has ten children. She sells vegetables from a cart on one of the main streets of the city of Ayacucho, which she doing all of her life. She is planning to start selling some meat products as well.

Marlene is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has one seven year old daughter. Marlene travels to markets around the region where she buys and sells things such as rice and sugar. She has been working in this business for four years. Marlene’s husband is currently sick, and Marlene is taking care of him.

Alejandra and Marlene need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy grains and vegetables.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is that each associate has an interest earning savings account. Alejandra and Marlene are currently using their savings to pay for their children’s school fees, buy a home, and pay for medical care.

loans.use: To buy grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Sandra Zulianita

texts.es:
Sandra is 26 years old and studied to be an executive secretary. She has one son who is dependent on her. They live in the district of El Porvenir, in the Trujillo province of La Libertad. When she finished her schooling, she looked for work in which she could use her education. She worked in a dental clinic, where she met many people in addition to the orthodontists and nurses. She realized that the dentists could not count on always the materials they needed. That's how she came up with the idea to begin selling the supplies inside of the clinic. Later, she moved on from this business and began a business renting out internet cabinas, from the beginning this business has gone very well.

Sandra is a member of the communal bank called Mujeres del Milenium, from whom she received her first loan to travel to Lima to purchase dental supplies. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will add audio and cameras to the computers, as well as hire a virus specialist. She also needs to pay for the monthly internet connection.

Sandra's goal is to set up a shop in her home and increase the number of computers.

La señora Sandra Z. R. tiene 26 años de edad, estudio la carrera de secretariado ejecutivo. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el distrito El Porvenir de la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Lñibertad. Cuando termino la carrera buscó un empleo para poder ejercerla, trabajaba en una clínica dental, allí conoció mucha gente entre ellas doctores odontólogos, enfermeras y otros. Se dio cuenta que los odontólogos no contaban con sus materiales dentales completos, es así como nace la idea de vender éstos materiales dentro de la clínica. Posteriormente renuncio a su trabajo para ingresar al negocio de alquiler de cabinas con Internet, desde que lo inició hasta el día de hoy le ha ido muy bien. La señora Sandra es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium”, lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con este monto viajo a la ciudad de Lima para comprar materiales dentales tales como: silicona, yonometro, alginatos, anestesias y agujas. Con el préstamo de S/. 1600.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses repondrá el audio y cámaras de las computadoras así también contratará a un especialista en la rama para limpiar a las maquinas de cualquier virus. Además mensualmente tiene que pagar la linea de internet que es sppedy 900. La señora Sandra se ha propuesto una meta que es acondicionar un locutorio en su casa e incrementar el numero de computadoras.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS RENTING INTERNET CABINAS, INCLUDING IMPROVEMENTS TO THE COMPUTERS AND HIRING A VIRUS SPECIALIST.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es:
Nemesio, 22 years old, is a native of the Saman district, a very humble area in the state of Puno. Two years ago he decided to relocate to the city of Juliaca in order to offer transportation service with his pedal-taxi. With this job he is trying to create better opportunities for his family and be able to offer well-being and security to his dear wife and young son who are still located in his hometown Saman. In addition to this work, in the early hours of the morning he works in a grain store called “Alprosur.” With these two jobs he will be able to eventually accomplish his goal: to live together with his family and enjoy the company of his wife and son. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to use for repairs the humble tools of his trade. Your generosity will permit him to reunite his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Nemesio, de 22 años de edad, es natural del distrito de Saman, distrito muy humilde del departamento de Puno, desde hace 2 años decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, para brindar servicio de movilidad en su triciclo, con este oficio trata de buscar mejores oportunidades para su familia y así ofrecerles bienestar y seguridad a su querida esposa y a su pequeño niño, quienes se encuentran en su pueblo natal Saman.Adicionalmente a esta labor desde altas horas de la madrugada se esfuerza trabajando como almacenista en una empresa de cereales “Alprosur”, con estas 2 labores podrá finalmente cumplir el anhelo que tiene, vivir junto a su familia y gozar de la compañía de su esposa e hijo. Por ese motivo solicita obtener un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en la reparación de su humilde herramienta de trabajo.“Tu generosidad permitirá mantener unida a su familia”

loans.use: Repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria Isabel is very agile and able. Her creativity has helped her in becoming very succesful in making accessories for handbags. She's a mother of 3 children. She has been doing this for the past 2 years. She began by selling these accessories in her native city of Juliaca, and after high demand she began exporting her products to La Paz, Bolivia.

Maria Isabel begins her day at 8:00 in the morning and ends at 6:00 in the evening. Her husband, who sells and buys used cars, helps her from time to time. Maria Isabel hopes to continue selling her products not only in her native country but throughout South America. Your help will allow her to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Isabel, es una mujer muy ágil y hábil, su creatividad la está llevando a tener éxito en su negocio de confección de correas y accesorios para carteras, ella es madre de 3 hijos desde hace 2 años está dedicada a esta actividad. Se inició vendiendo en su ciudad natal Juliaca, pero viendo la demanda del mercado decidió exportarlo a la paz (Bolivia), Maria Isabel inicia su faena diaria a las 8:00 de la mañana para culminarla a las 6:00 de la tarde, en ocasiones con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo Miguel, que se dedica a la compra y venta de carros.El deseo de Maria Isabel es seguir expandiendo su negocio, no sólo en el mercado nacional si no también internacional, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo. Vuestro aporte le dará la oportunidad de seguir incrementando su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Don Eusebio drives a tricycle for a living. He's an examplary and resourceful father who's 40 years old and about 3 years ago decided to provide transportation services to the people of Juliaca, even though it requires a lot of physical strength.

Eusebio has 4 young children who are very dedicated to their studies as a way to pay back their parents for all their hardwork. He and his wife both wish that their children will have a promising future. With this in mind, he works non-stop, with a lot of perseverance and dedication. Don Eusebio would like to purchase a tricycle so that he can then lease it out to other drivers. He hopes to increase his earnings which will help even more in paying for the schooling of their children. "Let's help achieve Don Eusebio's and his children's dreams".

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Su herramienta de trabajo es un triciclo y es indispensable para el desarrollo de don Eusebio, padre ejemplar y emprendedor de 40 años de edad, que desde hace 3 años con mucho esfuerzo físico decidió dedicarse a brindar servicios de transporte a la población Juliaqueña.Eusebio es padre de 4 menores hijos quienes se dedican íntegramente a sus estudios para corresponder el esfuerzo que hacen sus padres, el mayor anhelo que alberga junto a su inseparable esposa es ver profesionales y con un futuro promisorio a cada uno de sus retoños, con ese fin trabaja incansablemente con mucha más perseverancia y constancia.Don Eusebio tiene pensado adquirir otra movilidad (triciclo), él cree que alquilando esta herramienta podrá obtener ingresos económicos indispensables para la educación de sus hijos.“Ayudemos a concretar los sueños de don Eusebio y sus retoños”

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle and then lease it out

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia is a woman who suffered physical abuse from her husband for many years. She decided to leave him and to offer her kids a loving and peaceful environment. With the little bit of savings she had, she decided to purchase a sewing machine. With her agility and with the support of her children, she was able to make the finest and most beautiful skirts. She sells them at the local market in San Jose in the city of Juliaca.

This business is her main source of income for Emilia who's 36 years old. She's currently renting a house and this is where she has her workshop. She's having a lot of succes in this business.

She is asking that you reach to your good heart and lend her some money to purchase more basic materials such as fabric to continue making her beautiful skirts. "Your good heart will give this family a better quality of living".

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Emilia, es una mujer que durante muchos años sufrió constantes maltratos físicos de su esposo, por esa razón decidió separarse y ofrecerles un ambiente de tranquilidad y amor a sus hijos, con el poco dinero ahorrado que tenía decidió adquirir una máquina de coser y con su agilidad y el apoyo de sus hijos empezó a confeccionar hermosas y finas faldas que luego los lleva para su venta al mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca.Este negocio se ha convertido en el ingreso económico principal de la señora Emilia de 36 años de edad y sus retoños, ellos actualmente viven en un domicilio alquilado en donde también funciona su pequeño tallercito que gracias a su constancia y perseverancia ya está logrando tener éxito.En esta oportunidad recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima (tela) para seguir confeccionando sus hermosas y novedosas faldas “Tu buen corazón les dará la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida”

loans.use: To purchase basic materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana has always been a very hard-working woman, even though she's a little bit older now she still has strength and will-power to move ahead along with her devoted husband. They both work in the selling and buying of firewood. This job has given them the opportunity to support their 3 children. This loving couple are hard workers and very dedicated to their job.
